Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Step into a pivotal role within our ML Platform team, part of the Business Engine initiative â€” the backbone that empowers data scientists to move faster and smarter. We donâ€™t just build infrastructure; we architect the ML operating system for our company. And every day at work, you'll be doing your part for all the charities we support.

Weâ€™re a tight-knit team of pragmatic problem-solvers who thrive on complex technical challenges and believe in pushing boundaries without breaking things. Whether itâ€™s fine-tuning a CI/CD pipeline, scaling models across regions, or introducing the next wave of MLOps tooling, weâ€™re always looking for bold engineers who love the details and see the big picture.

AndrÃ© Bloemenkamp, ML Engineer: "As a ML Engineer at the Lottery, you build scalable ML pipelines in close collaboration with data scientists. You work on impactful projects with room for innovation and growth."

What Youâ€™ll Do


Architect and manage cloud infrastructure using Terraform and AWS best practices (SageMaker, IAM, S3, etc.)
Develop robust Python code to support the full ML lifecycle â€” from preprocessing to deployment orchestration.
Design CI/CD pipelines in GitLab for automated model versioning, validation, packaging, and deployment to SageMaker.
Deploy and monitor models using SageMaker Model Registry and Docker; automate alerts for drift, anomalies, and downtime.
Enable platform adoption by building reusable patterns and onboarding teams to ML tooling and workflows.
Promote engineering excellence through clean code, testing, type hints, linters, and strong documentation.
Diagnose and resolve system issues, optimize performance, and improve scalability, observability, and cost efficiency.


Youâ€™d Describe Yourself As Follows


At least 3â€“5 years in ML or MLOps focused on cloud-based, production systems, with solid understanding of deployment, monitoring, and model evaluation.
Strong Python & SQL skills with a focus on clean, maintainable code
Deep AWS expertise (SageMaker, S3, IAM, CloudWatch) and infrastructure as code using Terraform or similar.
Hands-on CI/CD experience, ideally with GitLab, deploying real ML workloads.
Proficient in Docker and container orchestration at scale.
Continuous learner and team contributor, with a bias for sharing knowledge.
A monthly salary indication between â‚¬5.000,- and â‚¬6.000,- based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours.


Join us! We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that â€“ we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each otherâ€™s welfare.

Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply â€“ whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy.

Please send your CV and cover letter (mandatory) to our Recruitment Business Partner Paulo Pablo through the link above.

Acquisition is not appreciated.

Wat bieden wij jou?

Een stevige basis

Je kunt rekenen op een goed salaris, variabele eindejaarsbonus en uitstekende pensioenregeling.

Ontwikkeling

Welke rol je ook hebt, het is voor ons belangrijk dat je kunt blijven ontwikkelen. Onze Lottery Academy heeft een groot aanbod aan trainingen, je hebt de kans om door te groeien en te werken aan internationale projecten.

Werken en reizen

Je werkt in ons duurzame gebouw, vlakbij station Amsterdam Zuid. Bovendien krijg je, bij een contract van meer dan 24 uur, een NS Business Card. Daarmee reis je gratis in heel Nederland, ook buiten werktijd!

Fun

Successen vieren we samen met collegaâ€™s tijdens maandelijkse borrels en feesten. Je ontdekt meer over onze goededoelenpartners tijdens inspirerende lezingen en activiteiten. En zo is er nog veel meer te beleven tijdens je werk bij de Loterijen.

Sport en ontspanning

Doe mee aan pilates, kickboksen of bootcamp, of bezoek op kantoor de fysio, vitaliteitscoach of stoelmasseur: gewoon op kantoor. Na werktijd geniet je met je VIP-KAART van gratis toegang tot 180 musea en korting op leuke uitjes.

Werk-privÃ©

Voor een goede werk-privÃ©balans heb je 28 vakantiedagen per jaar op basis van een 40-urige werkweek en zijn je werktijden flexibel. Word je moeder of vader? Gefeliciteerd! Tijdens je geboorte- en ouderschapsverlof betalen we je 100% door.

Leer het team kennen

The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech, and best-practices to help realize our growth ambition. In this hub you will be working together with business representatives to identify value adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You will be working on exciting and challenging BI, data & AI projects that create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organizations.

Over de Postcode Loterij & VriendenLoterij

Een marketing gedreven organisatie met een sociaal doel

De Postcode Lottery Group is een internationale non-profitorganisatie met een sterke focus op marketing. Met onze Loterijen zamelen we geld in voor een eerlijkere, groenere en gezondere wereld. Onze deelnemers winnen - samen met hun buren - Ã©n steunen goede doelen. Daâ€™s win-win!

Onze missie: een betere wereld, voor iedereen

Sinds 1989 haalden we, dankzij onze deelnemers, meer dan â‚¬ 15 miljard op voor duizenden goede doelen. Samen met de deelnemers en 1.500 collega's in Groot-BrittanniÃ«, Nederland, Zweden, Duitsland en Noorwegen haal jij elke dag weer â‚¬ 2,5 miljoen op voor goede doelen en dragen we allemaal bij aan een betere wereld. Dat is de kracht van samen: The Power of Postcodes.

Inclusie en gelijke kansen

Mensen staan centraal bij alles wat we doen. Of het nu gaat om ons team, onze deelnemers of de goede doelen die we steunen: het doel is bijdragen aan een eerlijkere en gelijkere wereld. We staan altijd open voor nieuwe ideeÃ«n en zetten ons in voor een inclusieve, diverse en representatieve werkomgeving. Klinkt perfect, maar ook wij zijn dat niet. We blijven daarom onszelf uitdagen om het beter te doen â€“ dat zit in ons DNA.

Title: Senior Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Browzwear is a leading provider of 3D fashion design and simulation software, driving digital transformation in the fashion industry. We have pioneered the use of 3D design for apparel and is widely adopted by major fashion brands and manufacturers.Â 

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior Deep Learning Engineer to join our innovative team. In this pivotal role, you will be at the forefront of developing cutting-edge solutions for complex geometric data. You will leverage your deep expertise to design, train, and validate sophisticated classifier and generative models, and you will have the unique opportunity to apply deep learning to solve complex computational challenges within our 3D technology stack.



What you will do

Design, implement, and train novel deep learning models for various tasks involving 3D geometric data, including classification and generation.
Develop and test advanced deep learning architectures for processing and analyzing 3D data formats, such as triangular meshes.
Explore and implement novel deep learning approaches to enhance and optimize our geometric algorithms and computational workflows.
Train and deploy models at scale using cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).1
Collaborate with fellow engineers and researchers to integrate deep learning models into our broader product and algorithmic pipelines.
Stay current with the latest advancements in deep learning, particularly in geometric deep learning and 3D computer vision.


What you bring

A Master's degree or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related scientific field.
A strong foundation in core mathematical concepts, including linear algebra, calculus, and probability theory.
Proven experience designing and training deep learning models, with a specific focus on 3D geometric data (e.g., triangular meshes).
Strong programming skills in C++Â and a good understanding of classical geometric algorithms.
Proficiency in a modern deep learning framework such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience training models in a cloud environment (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure).






ï»¿Nice to Have's

Specific experience with generative models (like GANs, VAEs, or Diffusion Models) for geometric data.
Prior experience applying machine learning to computational science or engineering problems.
Familiarity with mathematical topics such as differential geometryÂ or topology.
Familiarity with specialized 3D deep learning libraries (e.g., Kaolin).
Experience with software development best practices, including version control (Git), CI/CD, and containerization (Docker).

Title: AI Engineer
Description:
We're looking for experienced AI Engineers to strengthen our team!




Are you passionate about the recent breakthroughs in AI? Do you have the engineering expertise to design and develop cutting-edge AI applications? Join us in helping companies advance their businesses by building the next generation of AI solutions!




At Mozaik, we believe weâ€™re at the start of a new era where AI technology will transform businesses in ways still hard to imagine. We aim to shape this revolution and specialize in helping companies explore and harness the full potential of AI, offering you a front-row seat to the latest developments.




With our teamâ€™s unique blend of experience and expertise, we take a startup approach to innovationâ€”highly collaborative and focused on learning through building. Working closely with our clientsâ€™ product teams, we rapidly create transformative solutions that delight end-users and drive significant business impact.




Youâ€™ll thrive at Mozaik if you:

Are a proactive doer with a strong drive to build AI solutions that address complex business challenges.
Are pragmatic and have proven experienceÂ designing and building cloud-based data and AI applications.
Love to teach and explain technically complex problems and solutions to people who are not always technology-minded.




In the spirit of our daily work optimizing AI systems, letâ€™s engage in some contrastive learning to help fine-tune your fit for this role.Â Mozaik may not be the right match if you:

Are not able to take the technical lead in developing and bringing production-grade data & AI solutions to life.
Dislike to collaborating with co-located teams or lack the patience to help others adopt new technology.
Prefer a fully defined career path and arenâ€™t seeking a dynamic, adventure-filled opportunity at a startup.




What we offer:

â€¢ Competitive compensation

â€¢ Hardware of your choice

â€¢ A positive, no-nonsense, output-driven work environment

â€¢ Autonomy and the opportunity to work remotely

â€¢ A highly productive environment with ample learning and innovation opportunities




Please note that we are unable to provide visa sponsorship at the moment.




Are you ready to cut through the AI hype and make an impact with the latest AI breakthroughs?Â Weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Are you ready to cut through the AI hype and make an impact with the latest AI breakthroughs? Weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Title: AI Internship
Description:
Are you passionate about AI and eager to explore its real-world applications across different business domains? Nedstar is looking for two open-minded and curious AI interns to join our team for a 6-month internship starting at the same time.







As an AI intern at Nedstar, you wonâ€™t just be coding in a vacuumâ€”youâ€™ll be embedded in the business. Youâ€™ll work closely with different departments, observing processes and constantly asking, â€œWhy canâ€™t this be automated?â€ Your mission will be to identify optimization opportunities on a person-by-person, team-by-team basis and help us implement smarter, AI-driven solutions throughout the organization.




What youâ€™ll do:




â€¢ Dive into the daily operations of a dynamic trading company

â€¢ Collaborate with multiple departments (sales, logistics, finance, etc.) to spot inefficiencies

â€¢ Explore and prototype AI solutions tailored to specific business needs

â€¢ Translate AI concepts into practical, scalable improvements

â€¢ Learn from a team that values experimentation, curiosity, and innovation




What weâ€™re looking for:




â€¢ A genuine interest in Artificial Intelligence and its practical applications

â€¢ An open-minded, hands-on attitude

â€¢ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

â€¢ Ability to communicate well with both technical and non-technical colleagues

â€¢ Preferably enrolled in a relevant Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s program




What is in it for you?




Nedstar is an employer that takes care of you and your development: opportunities to learn, grow and develop
Competitive internship package, including a EUR 1100,- monthly allowance
Regular fun and social activities, boat trips (we just bought a boat for some after work fun time)
We are located in a beautiful centuries old canal house in the heart of Amsterdam
Open, friendly and fun company culture
Flexibility in your hours (if you like to go for a run during working hours, we encourage you to do so, because your well being is paramount to thrive and be at your best at work).







Please send your CV and cover letter to alessia@nedstar.com




We are looking forward to possibly welcoming you to our team!

Title: Internship AI & Data Science
Description:
What are you going to do as an AI & Data Science intern at Highberg?

Do you want to use your AI and data skills to optimize Employee Experience while helping well-known companies with their business performance? We are looking for people who enjoy turning complex data into understandable insights, are passionate about AI & data science and want to contribute to the development of HR technology.

Your work as an AI & Data Science intern at #Highberg

As an intern, you will work on exploring and prototyping an innovative AI solution that helps non-technical HR users work with complex HR data in a simple and intuitive way.

The core of the assignment: you will research and build a chat interface that allows users to query structured HR data from a data warehouse, without having to write SQL or needing technical prior knowledge.

In your research, you will explore questions such as:


How can we enable natural language queries on HR datasets using generative AI?
Which tools and technologies (e.g. Copilot, Azure OpenAI, LangChain, FastAPI) are best suited for this use case?
What are the options for integrating this solution into Power BI, including security aspects such as row-level security?
What does a reliable, explainable, and user-friendly solution look like in practice?


Although we already have ideas about possible tools and architectures, we deliberately keep the technology choice open. Together with colleagues, you will research and document various design options. The ultimate goal is integration of the assistant into Power BI, but your MVP may start as a stand-alone prototype.

With your work, you will contribute directly to our mission to make data-driven HR smarter, more accessible and future-proof.

What are we asking?


You are in the final year of a study at university level;
You have experience with Python and SQL, and preferably a visualisation tool such as Power BI;
Excellent communication skills in English, both written and oral;
You are available for â‰¥4 days a week for at least 6 months and within 1 hour travel from our office in Amsterdam RAI.


Who are you?


You have a passion for data, AI, programming, statistics/machine learning and research;
You are enterprising, creative, flexible, results-oriented, accurate and socially adept;
You get the best out of yourself in an environment where you are challenged to go outside your comfort zone and learn new things.


What are we offering?


A good internship allowance (EUR 550 per month) and training courses worth several thousand euros;
12.5 days' holiday (for a six-month full-time employment);
Starting from September or by mutual agreement;
Supervision by an experienced data scientist;
A pleasant working environment, short communication lines, focus on performance as a team and plenty of social activities such as get-togethers, sports activities and team meetings;
Our office is located at the Zuidas in Amsterdam and is easily accessible by public transport. We ask you to work at the office a minimum of two days a week, but you are always welcome, whether it is for the good coffee, a game of table tennis or just for your colleagues.


About The Team

You will join the People, Analytics & Research team, which is part of the Organisational & Sustainability Transformation Hub. The team consists of around 25 colleagues: consultants, researchers, data scientists and data engineers. A great team of smart and driven professionals, who are always there for you with a helping hand! We not only work hard together, but also have a lot of fun together - we organise social events and we do lots of fun activities, such as outings, Friday afternoon drinks and sports events.

We are happy to help

If you have any questions or would like to discuss this vacancy further about opportunities within Highberg, please contact Kevin O'Driscoll (Data Scientist), via kevin.odriscoll@highberg.comvalue:

About Highberg

Highberg originated from nine boutique consulting firms, each with best-in-class expertise in organizational, digital, and sustainability transformations. As a collective of multidisciplinary and talented boutique consulting companies, we combine our strengths to pursue one ambition: to become the leading transformation consulting group in Europe. We are proud to be a B Corp certified company, as we strive to care for our planet, society, and our employees.

Working at Highberg

At Highberg, we foster a supportive and collaborative culture. This culture is built on our three core values: Be Committed, Be Better, and Be You.
In â€™Be Committed,â€™ colleagues tirelessly strive for a lasting positive impact on our clients, society, and the environment. We are characterized by our entrepreneurial spirit and our collective commitment to the overall success of the company.
â€™Be Betterâ€™ is all about our belief in continuous learning and improvement, and we provide you with opportunities to grow and develop both personally and professionally. We strive for the highest standards of quality and professionalism in everything we do.
And last but definitely not least, â€™Be Youâ€™ is about encouraging you to bring your whole self to work, have fun, and embrace diversity and inclusion. We seek to establish personal connections with our clients and colleagues, building long-term, trust-based relationships.

Title: Data Science Associate
Description:
Who We Are

The next step of your career starts here, where you can bring your own unique mix of skills and perspectives to a fast-growing team.

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working
Be part of a fast-growing company that helps businesses leverage data analytics for better decision-making.
Collaborate with a highly skilled, dynamic, and supportive team.
Opportunities for career growth and continuous learning in analytics and consulting.
Competitive salary and benefits package, including training, mentorship, and travel opportunities.



What you will do


Conduct analyses using advanced analytical tools such as Python, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, and cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations and interactive dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, and Looker.
Solve complex problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses, and create actionable recommendations from data and analysis.
Prepare and facilitate workshops and training sessions for clients and team members.
Manage stakeholders and communicate effectively with executives.
Coach and mentor junior team members, fostering their growth and development.



What youâ€™ll bring


3+ years of professional work experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics).
Ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses, and derive recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills in data analysis, machine learning, and programming. Proficiency in Python, SQL, R, and cloud computing platforms.
Experience with Python data tools (e.g., Jupyter, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Matplotlib) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Ability to communicate complex statistical and analytical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent command of the English language.
Experience in consulting is a plus.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
AI Engineer â€“ 6+ Months â€“ Breda/Hybrid




Are you an AI Engineer with a passion for innovation, high-performance computing, and AI infrastructure? Do you enjoy building solutions from scratch in a fast-paced, exploratory environment? We're working with a forward-thinking organization in Breda that is embarking on an exciting new journey, developing an on-prem AI platform to support custom language model development for specialized ICT programs.




The Opportunity:

This is a greenfield project where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the architecture, environment setup, and tooling required to run and test LLMs (Large Language Models) on custom hardware in the client's private data center. The goal is to remove all barriers to experimentation, enabling instant testing and iteration with AI models on-premises.

You'll be responsible for researching, designing, and delivering the foundational environment and infrastructure, including tooling such as AutoShell AI, Jupyter, and high-performance computing (HPC) frameworks.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and deliver AI-ready cloud/on-prem environments tailored to language model experimentation
Set up and manage a secure and scalable HPC infrastructure in the client's datacenter
Build automated pipelines and tooling to enable fast, repeatable LLM testing
Research and evaluate techniques and tools (LLM frameworks, GPU utilization, etc.)
Integrate platforms like Jupyter for experimentation and visualization
Work closely with ICT stakeholders to ensure infrastructure meets their model and hardware needs
Define future architecture for on-prem AI capabilities with long-term scalability in mind




Key Skills and Experience:

Proven experience in cloud or on-prem infrastructure engineering for AI/ML applications
Experience with LLMs, AI tooling, and language model deployment workflows
Strong skills in Python, Shell scripting, and environmental automation
Familiarity with AutoShell AI, Jupyter, or similar AI toolchains (or willingness to ramp up quickly)
Background in high-performance computing (HPC) or GPU-intensive workloads
Understanding of hybrid environments, custom hardware integration, and data center operations
Ability to work independently and explore emerging AI infrastructure techniques




We aim to respond promptly to all applications. However, due to high volumes, there may be times when we cannot reply to every applicant. Thank you for your understanding.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Commercial Data Science Manager
Description:
Jul 31, 2025

Commercial Data Science Manager

About Barilla

At Barilla, we believe that every great journey begins with passion and a bold vision. From our humble beginnings in 1877 in a small shop in Parma, Italy, weâ€™ve blossomed into a global leader in the food industry, guided by our commitment to progress and excellence.

Today, Barilla is an international group present in more than 100 countries and we are proud to be recognized as the worldâ€™s top food company by reputation. With 22 beloved brands in our portfolio, we are world leader for pasta, the number one choice for ready-made sauces in Europe, leader for bakery products in Italy, and for crispbread across Scandinavia with Wasa.

Our success story is written by a passionate team of almost 9,000 dedicated employees across 30 plants and offices worldwide, all united by a shared mission to nourish the future with purpose and passion.

Are you ready to add your unique flavor to our journey?

Job Description

Sitting in the Global Growth Function, this role leads data science efforts in our commercial and executional analytics space. Youâ€™ll work on price elasticity, pack and promo optimisation, and drive automation of commercial insights that inform the frontline.

Key Accountabilities


Build and deliver predictive models on pricing, promo, distribution, and executional performance
Deliver PoCs in 6â€“8 weeks and support transition to Global Business Technology (IT) teams for scale-up
Partner with commercial teams to turn models into everyday tools
Oversee internal and agency analysts and translators
Deliver actionable insights, not just predictive outputs
Support the development of dashboards and automated signal tracking
Coach agency data analysts to ensure alignment with business needs


Desired Skills And Background


5+ years in commercial analytics, trade or pricing analytics, or field execution
Experience in an agency, CPG, retail, FMCG or similar environment
Strong technical foundation (Python, SQL, PySpark, predictive modelling)
Clear understanding of commercial KPIs and pricing theory
Excellent business communication skills and stakeholder alignment
Knowledge of AI, automation, and end-to-end delivery practices
Degree in a quantitative or analytical discipline


We Offer


A central location in Amsterdam Zuid with excellent access to public transportation.
Hybrid working model.
Opportunity to grow professionally through international projects.
A dynamic and inclusive team culture


Additional Information


This position reports to the Data & Analytics Associate Director.
The expected start date is October 2025.


At Barilla, we are committed to creating an inclusive and equitable workplace where diversity in all its forms is valued and embraced. Our employment policies and practices are designed to ensure equal employment opportunities for all, regardless of age, race, color, citizenship, faith, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, gender identity or characteristics of expression, sexual orientation, marital status, genetic information, medical condition, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. Our commitment to equal employment stems from our unwavering belief that it is not only the right thing to do, but it is also a fundamental driver of innovation and business success.

Information Technology

Netherlands

Amsterdam

Permanent

Title: Data Scientist - Uitzendbureau.nl
Description:
Voor het leukste, uitdagendste, hipste, creatiefste, meest flexibele en ambitieuze adviesbureau binnen de logistiek en openbaar vervoersector zoeken wij een nieuwe bondgenoot.

Jouw rol

Als Data Scientist breng jij de beste analyses en oplossingen. Je werkt graag aan complexe analytische problemen, zoals netwerkoptimalisaties, simulaties en vraag-aanbod optimalisaties. In gesprek met klanten kun jij als geen ander gecompliceerde modellen uitleggen.

Een aantal van jouw taken zouden zijn:



Het programmeren, uitdenken, in productie zetten en onderhouden van nieuwe modellen. Je gaat aan de slag met vraagstukken als: â€œHoe voorspellen we wanneer spooronderdelen het beste vervangen kunnen worden?â€.
Sparren met de klant om goed te achterhalen welk product gerealiseerd moet worden, hoe en waarom. Hiervoor duik je de ruwe data in om daar nieuwe business inzichten uit te halen en daar creatieve oplossingen voor te bedenken.
Adviseren over de toepassing van nieuwe technieken en mogelijkheden.
Het begeleiden en aansturen van collegaâ€™s.



Wie we zoeken



Je hebt een kwantitatieve studie afgerond in Econometrie, Operations Research, Wiskunde, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science of een andere relevante studie
In staat om, naar aanleiding van vragen uit de business, beslissingen te nemen over de geschikte oplossingsmethode
Hebt een talenknobbel die voornamelijk uit programmeertalen bestaat (waaronder Python of vergelijkbare programmeertalen)
Hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist
Ervaring met het uitvoeren van data projecten, cloud platforms en het in productie zetten van ML modellen
Een goede kennis van de Nederlandse taal, zowel in woord als schrift

Over Lynxx

Je komt terecht bij een ambitieus adviesbureau waar data centraal staat. Hierbij ligt de focus voornamelijk op de Openbaar Vervoersector. Samen in teams wordt gewerkt aan data vraagstukken bij zowel grote als kleine organisaties binnen deze niche markt. De cultuur is direct en persoonlijk met een dynamisch en leuk team. Het is een plek waar je mee kan denken, jouw creativiteit kwijt kan en echt impact hebt op bedrijfsprocessen.

LYNXX biedt een energieke werkomgeving met een team van gedreven adviseurs. Binnen ons bureau leer je hands-on werken door concrete opdrachten. Wij vinden het ook belangrijk dat jij je horizon verbreedt, door te studeren aan de beste opleidingen en door regelmatig te reizen. De cultuur binnen het team is direct en persoonlijk. Hierdoor zul je je zowel inhoudelijk als op persoonlijk vlak snel verder ontwikkelen.

Voor het leukste, uitdagendste, hipste, creatiefste, meest flexibele en ambitieuze adviesbureau binnen de logistiek en openbaar vervoersector zoeken wij een nieuwe bondgenoot.

Jouw rol

Als Data Scientist breng jij de beste analyses en oplossingen. Je werkt graag aan complexe analytische problemen, zoals netwerkoptimalisaties, simulaties en vraag-aanbod optimalisaties. In gesprek met klanten kun jij als geen ander gecompliceerde modellen uitleggen.

Een aantal van jouw taken zouden zijn:


  • Het programmeren, uitdenken, in productie zetten en onderhouden van nieuwe modellen. Je gaat aan de slag met vraagstukken als: â€œHoe voorspellen we wanneer spooronderdelen het beste vervangen kunnen worden?â€.
  • Sparren met de klant om goed te achterhalen welk product gerealiseerd moet worden, hoe en waarom. Hiervoor duik je de ruwe data in om daar nieuwe business inzichten uit te halen en daar creatieve oplossingen voor te bedenken.
  • Adviseren over de toepassing van nieuwe technieken en mogelijkheden.
  • Het begeleiden en aansturen van collegaâ€™s.

Title: Analist Life Science - Jobbird.com
Description:
Als Analist Life Science zal je voornamelijk verantwoordelijk zijn voor de uitvoering van verschillende moleculaire, biochemische en microbiologische laboratoriumtesten. Denk hierbij aan:



Het testen van medicijnen op verschillende in vitro systemen, waarbij de nadruk meestal ligt op cel- en/of bacteriemodellen
Bezig zijn met verschillende technieken zoals FACS/Flow Cytometrie en het uitvoeren van eiwit assays zoals Western-Blot en ELISA's
Het purificeren van DNA/RNA/eiwitten en het opwerken van biologisch materiaal voor diverse analyses
Het uitvoeren van klassieke microbiologische testen zoals endotoxine- en kiemgetalbepalingen
Het nauwkeurig rapporteren en documenteren van data
Werken conform SOPs en mogelijk onder GMP/ISO- kwaliteitsnormen



Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Na Rae de Jong: 088 00 211 23 // narae@checkmark.nl

Vacaturenummer: 8377

Voor onze opdrachtgevers in Harderwijk en omstreken zoeken wij regelmatig naar enthousiaste kandidaten met een life science opleiding. Het betreft opdrachtgevers in verschillende sectoren, zoals de farmacie, biotech en Food/Feed, waar Quality Control en Research & Development wordt uitgevoerd op het laboratorium. De opties zijn dus erg divers.

Title: Machine Operator - Bergen (LI)
HTML:
3-Ploegendienst | â‚¬3.350 per maand

Je nieuwe baan

Wat ga je allemaal doen?

Heb jij ervaring in de productie en wil je werken met moderne machines in een veilige, schone werkomgeving? Dan is deze baan als Machine Operator echt iets voor jou! Jij zorgt ervoor dat het productieproces vlekkeloos verloopt en dat elk product voldoet aan onze hoge kwaliteitsstandaarden. Je werkt met extruders, voert controles uit en denkt actief mee over duurzame productie.

ï»¿Wat ga je doen?

  • Voorbereiden van de productie: machines instellen, kleuren wisselen en materialen klaarmaken;
  • Bewaken van het productieproces en machines bijstellen voor een optimaal resultaat;
  • Uitvoeren van kwaliteitscontroles volgens vaste procedures;
  • Stimuleren van hergebruik van materialen voor een duurzamere werkwijze;
  • Oplossen van kleine storingen en uitvoeren van eenvoudige technische reparaties;
  • Zorgen voor een veilige en opgeruimde werkplek volgens de veiligheidsrichtlijnen.

Wat we verwachten

En waar we op hameren

  • Ervaring als operator in een productieomgeving (kunststofervaring is een prÃ©);
  • Je werkt zelfstandig, bent oplossingsgericht en denkt mee;
  • Flexibel en bereid om in een 3-ploegendienst te werken (ochtend, middag, nacht);
  • Je houdt van techniek en zoekt een plek waar je je verder kunt ontwikkelen.

Wat we jou bieden

Naast persoonlijk contact

  • Een bruto maandsalaris tot â‚¬3.350 inclusief ploegentoeslag;
  • Reiskostenvergoeding van â‚¬0,23/km, zonder maximale afstand;
  • Pensioenopbouw vanaf je eerste werkdag, 8,33% vakantiegeld Ã©n een eindejaarsuitkering;
  • Ruimte voor persoonlijke groei via interne opleidingen en cursussen;
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar bijvoorbeeld teamleider of technisch specialist;
  • Werken in een innovatief bedrijf waar duurzaamheid en veiligheid voorop staan.

Over het bedrijf

Een korte introductie

Een vertrouwde leverancier en partner voor de bouw- en elektrotechnische groothandel. Met een breed assortiment aan betrouwbare kabelproducten en eersteklas service ondersteunen zij uiteenlopende projecten. Dankzij meer dan 100 jaar ervaring leveren zij hoogwaardige producten die voldoen aan de strengste eisen. Hun klantgerichte aanpak blijkt uit hun actieve rol in lokale bouwprojecten, het investeren in jong talent en hun bijdrage aan de ontwikkeling van de elektrotechnische sector op nationaal niveau. Bij hen staan kwaliteit en klanttevredenheid centraal. Ze positioneren zichzelf niet alleen als leverancier, maar als een onmisbare partner binnen de sector.

Title: Global Strategy and Transformation Lead
Description:
Note: Deadline for applying is 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.

UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM â€“ Global Strategy and Transformation Lead

Location: Amsterdam, Latin America or Asia

Full-time: Yes

Local conditions applyâ€¯

â€¯

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but at this stage we will not take your application forward. We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.

If you are in the Unilever Ice Cream business or consider choosing to work for the Unilever Ice Cream business, you will work for the Global, leading Ice Cream player with â‚¬7.9bn Turn Over in 2023. The Ice Cream business is operating in a highly attractive category, as we are part of the 1 trillion snacking and refreshment industry, growing consistently at high pace. We have strong brands equities: 5 of top 10 selling brands including Wallâ€™s, Magnum, Ben &Jerryâ€™s. We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of Ice Cream as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen by November 2025.

Ice Cream has distinct characteristics from Unileverâ€™s other operating businesses and the growth potential of Ice Cream will be better delivered under a different ownership structure. As Ice Cream company we are committed to developing and nurturing talent within our Ice Cream company. You will have ample options for career growth and exploration, allowing you for you to explore roles and opportunities across the new organisation. Your career development will be a priority for us, and we are dedicated to supporting your growth journey within the new company. We hope that you will want to build the new chapter of our Ice Cream history together with us.

ABOUT ICE CREAM: Life Tastes Better with Ice Cream

Unilever Ice Cream is the largest global Ice Cream Company in the world, with over 100 years of experience delivering a diverse range of indulgent, yet responsible, craft food experiences and treats delighting consumers. Committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability we have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wallâ€™s, Ben & Jerryâ€™s), a strong presence in over 60 countries, generating annual revenue of over $8 billion. All brands are driven to transform moments into memories through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on where to play and how to win.

We turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by designing unique and innovative Ice Cream experiences that make life taste better, creating joyful experiences. In our Ice Cream business, weâ€™re crafting the future through innovation and imaginative minds, creating unique products. We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. However, it is not as simple as it may seem. As Ice Cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products.

Job Purpose

Support the Global Head in shaping and evolving the global strategy. Lead the implementation of strategic initiatives across regions, with a focus on transformation, digital health, mental health integration, and health equity. This role will also hold regional operational responsibility for either Asia-Pacific, China, and ANZ or Americas and Europe.

Key Responsibilities


Support the Global Head in developing and evolving the global medical and occupational health strategy.
Lead the implementation of strategic initiatives across all regions under the direction of the Global Head.
Design and govern the global mental health ecosystem, integrating EAP, digital tools, and workplace policies.
Own the digital health strategy, including EMR integration, health analytics, and outcome dashboards.
Promote health equity and inclusive access to care across all geographies.
Develop and track global KPIs and OKRs for medical and occupational health impact.
Facilitate employee feedback mechanisms to inform continuous improvement of health services.
Oversee outsourced medical and occupational health service providers in APAC, China, and ANZ, or Americas and Europe.
Collaborate with regional HR and SHE leads to embed medical and occupational health into local operations.
Ensure compliance with global and local health data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and ethical standards.
Represent the function in specialized cross-functional councils.
Support innovation and evidence-based practice through partnerships and research scouting.


What You Need To Succeed

EXPERIENCES & QUALIFICATIONS


Advanced degrees in public health or occupational health is a must.
10+ years of experience in corporate medical and occupational health strategy, digital health, or transformation roles is a must.
Experience working across Americas and European regulatory environments.
Familiarity with global health trends, digital health platforms, and mental health systems.


Skills


Strategic Thinking & Visioning: Ability to shape and evolve global health strategies aligned with business transformation goals.
Digital Health Leadership: Expertise in EMR integration, health analytics, and digital platforms for occupational and mental health.
Programme & Change Management: Skilled in leading complex, multi-region transformation programmes with measurable impact.
Mental Health Ecosystem Design: Experience integrating EAPs, digital tools, and workplace policies into a cohesive global framework.
Health Equity Advocacy: Ability to promote inclusive access to care and embed equity principles into global health strategy.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Proficient in developing and tracking KPIs/OKRs and using health data to inform continuous improvement.
Global Regulatory Fluency: Strong understanding of GDPR, HIPAA, and other health data privacy regulations across regions.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven ability to work across HR, SHE, Legal, and external partners to embed health into operations.
Innovation & Research Scouting: Ability to identify and integrate evidence-based practices and emerging health technologies.
Communication & Influence: Skilled in engaging senior stakeholders and representing the function in strategic councils.
Systems Thinking: Capacity to connect strategic initiatives across geographies, functions, and platforms for cohesive execution.
Organisational Agility: Ability to navigate ambiguity, influence across matrixed structures, and adapt strategy in fast-evolving business environments (especially relevant during the Ice Cream business separation).
Innovation Management: Ability to scout, pilot, and scale health innovations (e.g. AI diagnostics, wearable tech, predictive analytics).
Storytelling & Strategic Communication: Skill in translating complex health data and strategy into compelling narratives for executive stakeholders and frontline teams alike.
Sustainability & ESG Alignment: Understanding of how health strategy contributes to broader environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals, including workforce resilience and responsible sourcing.


Leadership


You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team delivers with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins.
You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenges with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors
PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others.
PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people â€“ coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is a service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.

WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?â€¯

â€¯

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do â€“ creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!â€¯â€¯


Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme.â€¯
Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.â€¯â€¯
Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.â€¯â€¯
We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.â€¯â€¯
Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate.â€¯ For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.â€¯â€¯â€¯
My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).â€¯
Home work allowance
Company laptop and mobile phone
Green Mobility Policy


EXCITED?â€¯

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. â€¯Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.â€¯

Looking forward to meeting you!â€¯â€¯â€¯

â€¯

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.â€¯â€¯

â€¯

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.â€¯â€¯

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.â€¯

HTML:
Note: Deadline for applying is 23.59 the day before the Job Posting End Date.

UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM â€“ Global Strategy and Transformation Lead

Location: Amsterdam, Latin America or Asia

Full-time: Yes

Local conditions applyâ€¯

â€¯

For the recruitment of this position, we would like to emphasize that local conditions apply to the position and for this vacancy in principle we will consider candidates based in the set locations. If you are based outside of these locations and you are interested to apply, please feel free to do so but at this stage we will not take your application forward. We will only consider your application if a decision is made to also recruit outside of the set locations.

If you are in the Unilever Ice Cream business or consider choosing to work for the Unilever Ice Cream business, you will work for the Global, leading Ice Cream player with â‚¬7.9bn Turn Over in 2023. The Ice Cream business is operating in a highly attractive category, as we are part of the 1 trillion snacking and refreshment industry, growing consistently at high pace. We have strong brands equities: 5 of top 10 selling brands including Wallâ€™s, Magnum, Ben &Jerryâ€™s. We are investing to unlock the full growth potential of Ice Cream as a standalone entity, once we separate from Unilever, which is planned to happen by November 2025.

Ice Cream has distinct characteristics from Unileverâ€™s other operating businesses and the growth potential of Ice Cream will be better delivered under a different ownership structure. As Ice Cream company we are committed to developing and nurturing talent within our Ice Cream company. You will have ample options for career growth and exploration, allowing you for you to explore roles and opportunities across the new organisation. Your career development will be a priority for us, and we are dedicated to supporting your growth journey within the new company. We hope that you will want to build the new chapter of our Ice Cream history together with us.

ABOUT ICE CREAM: Life Tastes Better with Ice Cream

Unilever Ice Cream is the largest global Ice Cream Company in the world, with over 100 years of experience delivering a diverse range of indulgent, yet responsible, craft food experiences and treats delighting consumers. Committed to innovation, quality, and sustainability we have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wallâ€™s, Ben & Jerryâ€™s), a strong presence in over 60 countries, generating annual revenue of over $8 billion. All brands are driven to transform moments into memories through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on where to play and how to win.

We turn the ordinary into the extraordinary by designing unique and innovative Ice Cream experiences that make life taste better, creating joyful experiences. In our Ice Cream business, weâ€™re crafting the future through innovation and imaginative minds, creating unique products. We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. However, it is not as simple as it may seem. As Ice Cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products.

Job Purpose

Support the Global Head in shaping and evolving the global strategy. Lead the implementation of strategic initiatives across regions, with a focus on transformation, digital health, mental health integration, and health equity. This role will also hold regional operational responsibility for either Asia-Pacific, China, and ANZ or Americas and Europe.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the Global Head in developing and evolving the global medical and occupational health strategy.
  • Lead the implementation of strategic initiatives across all regions under the direction of the Global Head.
  • Design and govern the global mental health ecosystem, integrating EAP, digital tools, and workplace policies.
  • Own the digital health strategy, including EMR integration, health analytics, and outcome dashboards.
  • Promote health equity and inclusive access to care across all geographies.
  • Develop and track global KPIs and OKRs for medical and occupational health impact.
  • Facilitate employee feedback mechanisms to inform continuous improvement of health services.
  • Oversee outsourced medical and occupational health service providers in APAC, China, and ANZ, or Americas and Europe.
  • Collaborate with regional HR and SHE leads to embed medical and occupational health into local operations.
  • Ensure compliance with global and local health data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA) and ethical standards.
  • Represent the function in specialized cross-functional councils.
  • Support innovation and evidence-based practice through partnerships and research scouting.

What You Need To Succeed

EXPERIENCES & QUALIFICATIONS

  • Advanced degrees in public health or occupational health is a must.
  • 10+ years of experience in corporate medical and occupational health strategy, digital health, or transformation roles is a must.
  • Experience working across Americas and European regulatory environments.
  • Familiarity with global health trends, digital health platforms, and mental health systems.

Skills

  • Strategic Thinking & Visioning: Ability to shape and evolve global health strategies aligned with business transformation goals.
  • Digital Health Leadership: Expertise in EMR integration, health analytics, and digital platforms for occupational and mental health.
  • Programme & Change Management: Skilled in leading complex, multi-region transformation programmes with measurable impact.
  • Mental Health Ecosystem Design: Experience integrating EAPs, digital tools, and workplace policies into a cohesive global framework.
  • Health Equity Advocacy: Ability to promote inclusive access to care and embed equity principles into global health strategy.
  • Data-Driven Decision Making: Proficient in developing and tracking KPIs/OKRs and using health data to inform continuous improvement.
  • Global Regulatory Fluency: Strong understanding of GDPR, HIPAA, and other health data privacy regulations across regions.
  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Proven ability to work across HR, SHE, Legal, and external partners to embed health into operations.
  • Innovation & Research Scouting: Ability to identify and integrate evidence-based practices and emerging health technologies.
  • Communication & Influence: Skilled in engaging senior stakeholders and representing the function in strategic councils.
  • Systems Thinking: Capacity to connect strategic initiatives across geographies, functions, and platforms for cohesive execution.
  • Organisational Agility: Ability to navigate ambiguity, influence across matrixed structures, and adapt strategy in fast-evolving business environments (especially relevant during the Ice Cream business separation).
  • Innovation Management: Ability to scout, pilot, and scale health innovations (e.g. AI diagnostics, wearable tech, predictive analytics).
  • Storytelling & Strategic Communication: Skill in translating complex health data and strategy into compelling narratives for executive stakeholders and frontline teams alike.
  • Sustainability & ESG Alignment: Understanding of how health strategy contributes to broader environmental, social, and governance (ESG) goals, including workforce resilience and responsible sourcing.

Leadership

  • You are an inclusive motivator of people. Your team delivers with real passion, growing and learning from each other whilst delivering quick wins.
  • You are still responsible for your own results and as a manager, you also need to motivate others to deliver with passion, creating an inclusive and engaging climate around you. You can balance challenges with support and coaching. You understand the wider business context and you are emotionally intelligent enough to motivate people to deliver what is needed.
  • Critical SOL (Standards of Leadership) Behaviors
    • PERSONAL MASTERY: Sets high standards for themselves. Has emotional intelligence to take feedback, manage mood and motivations, and build empathy for others.
    • PASSION FOR HIGH PERFORMANCE: Generates intensity and focus to motivate people to deliver results at speed. Takes personal responsibility and accountability for execution and results.
    • TALENT CATALYST: Invests in people â€“ coaches individuals and teams to realize their full potential. Creates an inclusive climate, empowering everyone to be at their best.
    • PURPOSE & SERVICE: Has humility, understanding that leadership is a service to others, inside and outside Unilever.
    • CONSUMER LOVE: Invests time inside and outside to understand the needs of consumers.
    • BUSINESS ACUMEN: Creates sustainable growth with purpose, engaging different partners across the system for change.
WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?â€¯

â€¯

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do â€“ creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!â€¯â€¯

  • Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus and share scheme.â€¯
  • Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.â€¯â€¯
  • Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.â€¯â€¯
  • We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.â€¯â€¯
  • Under the Hybrid Working principles, you will be expected to spend a minimum of 40% in the office or at customers, suppliers or partners to connect and collaborate.â€¯ For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped. When you are at the office, you can enjoy our tasty canteen with prepped food and own products.
  • Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.â€¯â€¯â€¯
  • My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).â€¯
  • Home work allowance
  • Company laptop and mobile phone
  • Green Mobility Policy

EXCITED?â€¯

Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. â€¯Your application will be reviewed against our requirements, and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.â€¯

Looking forward to meeting you!â€¯â€¯â€¯

â€¯

Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.â€¯â€¯

â€¯

Equal Opportunity Employer: Unilever is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regards to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, disability, age, parenthood, pregnancy or any other basis protected by applicable law, and will not be discriminated against.â€¯â€¯

By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.â€¯

Title: AI and Emerging Technologies Expert
Description:
AI and Emerging Technologies Expert




Location: Europe (remote/on-site as needed)

Duration: Up to 12 months

Estimated Workload: Short-term assignments / task-based consultancy




About the Opportunity: We are creating a pool of AI and Emerging Technologies Experts for a new FWC Contract: EC-SG REFORM/2025/OP/0001: Provision of consultancy services to support the design, development, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of structural reforms in EU Member State. Experts in this pool will be contacted for specific assignments as they arise. If you have relevant experience we encourage you to apply.




Key Responsibilities:

Design and evaluate AI use cases for chatbots, predictive analytics, and pre-filled forms in public service delivery.
Advise on the selection of tools and approaches for intelligent automation in administrative processes.
Develop a proof of concept (PoC) to demonstrate AI feasibility within redesigned service workflows.
Ensure alignment with EU AI Act principles, data privacy, and transparency standards.




Qualifications:

Background in computer science, data analytics, or AI systems.
5+ years of experience applying AI solutions in the public sector or related regulatory settings.
Familiarity with explainable AI, digital ethics, and user acceptance of AI tools.
Demonstrated experience developing or assessing prototypes or PoC for service innovation.

Show more

Title: Sport/ Fashion verkoopspecialist 32-38 uur in Den Bosch
Description:
Locatie: Den Bosch - Aangemaakt : 14 mei 2025

Contact

Zo Kun Je Me Bereiken

E-mail : vacature@twinsport.nl

Maak van je werk een sport als Sport/Fashion verkoopspecialist

Je staat bekend als sportliefhebber en hebt goede verkoopskills en ben je op de hoogte van de nieuwst mode- sport trends? Dan zoeken wij jou voor deze afwisselende baan als allround verkoopspecialist bij Twin Sport in Den Bosch. Solliciteer nu!

Fulltime 32-38 uur per week

Jij bent een sportliefhebber op de meest hippe sneakers

Wat jouw specialiteit is op sportgebied? Goede vraag! Je weet eigenlijk van iedere sport wel iets. Jij bent degene die vanaf de bank sportcommentaar levert bij iedere sport wedstrijd, met name op de kleding van de sporters want daar weet je ect alles van! Daarna trek je je nieuwst sport outfit aan om zelf een rondje hard te lopen. Je allround kennis over de laatste modetrends en producten kun je op de winkelvloer van Twin Sport in Den Bosch goed kwijt. Je pikt twijfelende klanten er zo uit en voorziet ze van overtuigend advies. Op zeker dat ze met jouw meedenkende houding en jou kennis met het juiste artikel en een glimlach op hun gezicht de deur uit lopen!

Dit ga je doen

Tijdens je werkdag kun je al je sport en mode kennis kwijt bij onze klanten. Je voelt precies aan wat de behoeftes zijn van iedere klant en speelt daarop in met het juiste advies. Het uiteindelijke doel? Op de eerste plaats een tevreden klant daarnaast willen we de verkoopcijfers maximaliseren. Je houdt je dan ook niet alleen bezig met verkoop, maar kijkt ook samen met je afdelingsmanager naar de presentatie, voorraadbeheer en leveringen van ons assortiment.


Als visitekaartje van de afdeling sport fashion geef je iedereen een welkom gevoel
Je bent op de hoogte van ons assortiment
Je spot snel klanten die vragen hebben en gaat geen uitdaging uit de weg.
Je luistert, vraagt door en geeft klanten vervolgens een passend advies
Je denkt verder en brengt klanten op nieuwe ideeÃ«n
Je optimaliseert verkoopcijfers.


Hiermee scoor je punten


Je hebt een rugzak aan kennis op het gebied van sport, sportkleding en bent op de hoogte van de laatste modetrends op sport gebied.
Je hebt ervaring in de retail
Als allemansvriend spreek jij de taal van elke klant
Doorpakken is je motto
Je bent ook beschikbaar in het weekend, tijdens koopavonden en in vakantieperiodes.


Dit is je winst


Een salaris dat past bij je functie en ervaring
Een warm welkom in een energiek, groeiend bedrijf
Een motiverende werksfeer waar je je vernieuwende ideeÃ«n kwijt kunt
Alle kansen om met ons mee te groeien
Goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
Personeelskorting op al onze merken
Leuke, energieke collegaâ€™s die altijd in zijn voor een potje darten of een gezellige vrijdagmiddagborrel.


Maak van je werk een sport!

Trek jij een sprintje naar Twin Sport voor deze baan? Dan beland je in het sportieve hart van Den Bosch Twin Sport begon in 1993 als winkel van 100m2 en is inmiddels uitgegroeid tot grote speler in sportland. We hebben 16 winkels en een goedlopende webshop. Dankzij goed advies vindt iedere sporter wat hij of zij nodig heeft.

Solliciteren?

Bij Twin Sport klim je zo omhoog dat erepodium op. Als je wilt tenminste. We zitten midden in een vernieuwing en nemen je graag mee in onze groei. Ben jij die topverkoper met een passie voor sport? Stuur dan je sollicitatiebrief en cv met pasfoto naar vacature@twinsport.nl t.a.v. Raoel Noijen

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Is je interesse gewekt?

Solliciteren

Profielfoto *

Naam *

Voornaam *

E-mailadres *

Bericht *

Bestand uploaden * Maximale bestandsgrootte : 3 MB - Toegestane bestandsextensies: .png, .pdf - Maximaal aantal bestanden : 2

Privacy

Door verder te gaan bevestigt u dat u onze privacyverklaring hebt gelezen en onze algemene voorwaarden heeft geaccepteerd. *

Title: Mechanical Engineer Offshore
Description:
Over KENC Engineering

KENC Engineering is een innovatief bedrijf dat zich richt op het ontwerpen en bouwen van geavanceerde tools voor de offshore-industrie. Onze klanten behoren tot de wereldtop en opereren wereldwijd met hun schepen. Wij staan bekend om onze creatieve oplossingen en streven altijd naar het allerbeste resultaat.

Ons internationale team bestaat uit gedreven en ambitieuze professionals die eigenaarschap nemen, het beste van zichzelf geven en solide, duurzame oplossingen bedenken voor onze klanten.

Het KENC-team is in volle ontwikkeling en onze ambitieuze groeiplannen vragen om jouw expertise!

Functieomschrijving

Als Mechanical Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor de uitvoering van het ontwerp van onze complete machine of onderdelen daarvan. In je dagelijkse werkzaamheden bedenk en ontwikkel je concepten, modelleer je deze in SolidWorks en valideer je je ontwerpen met handberekeningen. Je bent betrokken bij het volledige ontwerptraject, van conceptfase tot detailuitwerking. Dagelijks werk je aan nieuwe oplossingen waarin je jouw creativiteit en passie voor techniek kwijt kunt.

Jouw verantwoordelijkheden omvatten


Ontwikkelen van tools voor onze projecten in de hernieuwbare energie, zoals installatiesystemen voor windturbines.
Bedenken en creÃ«ren van nieuwe concepten en vervolgens uitwerken in SolidWorks.
Samenwerken in projectgroepen om vervolgens een ontwerp aan de klant te kunnen leveren.



Wie zoeken wij?

Heb jij een stevige technische basis, opgebouwd tijdens je studie of al enige jaren werkervaring? En passie voor grote offshore constructies? Dan zijn we op zoek naar jou! We zoeken een nieuwsgierige en gedreven engineer die niet terugdeinst voor het stellen van kritische vragen. Samenwerken aan slimme, praktische oplossingen zie jij als een uitdaging. Of je net bent afgestudeerd of al ervaring hebt, als je graag de diepte ingaat en met jouw inzet projecten met echte impact wilt realiseren, dan pas je perfect in ons team.

Daarnaast heb je:


Een afgeronde bachelor of masterdiploma in Werktuigbouwkunde, Industrial Design Engineering of aanverwante.
Als teamspeler werk je graag samen binnen verschillende projectgroepen.
Je beschikt over een creatieve en veerkrachtige instelling.



Wat bieden wij?


Een salaris tussen de â‚¬3.200 en â‚¬4.000 per maand (afhankelijk van ervaring).
Een uitdagende functie met veel verantwoordelijkheid en ruimte voor eigen initiatief.
28 vakantiedagen op basis van een fulltime werkweek.
8% vakantiegeld in mei, zodat je een mooie vakantie kan boeken.
De kans om mee te bouwen aan de verdere groei van KENC en een betere toekomst!
Persoonlijke winstuitkering bij positief bedrijfsresultaat.
Volop ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en doorgroei.



Wil je meer weten over deze functie of kennismaken? Neem dan contact op met Corporate Recruiter BjÃ¶rn Hulsman viaâ€¯06 5347 1878â€¯(ook via WhatsApp).

Wil je meer weten over deze functie of kennismaken? Neem dan contact op met Corporate Recruiter BjÃ¶rn Hulsman viaâ€¯06 5347 1878â€¯(ook via WhatsApp).

Title: Opleiding tot Vaatlaborant
Description:
Leerling vaatlaborant

Hier combineer je technische skills met persoonlijk contact, in een hecht team met korte lijnen. Ga jij deze uitdaging aan als leerling vaatlaborant?

De functie

Als leerling vaatlaborant:


Werk je onder supervisie binnen het team Vaatdiagnostiek.
Krijg je een brede opleiding in non-invasieve vaatdiagnostiek.
Voer je zelfstandig onderzoeken uit en leer je deze te interpreteren en rapporteren bij zowel poliklinische als klinische patiÃ«nten.
Voer je arteriÃ«le en veneuze duplexen uit, waaronder (pre-)shuntonderzoeken, aneurysmacontroles, spataderonderzoeken en TIA-analyses.
Werk je met een dopplerapparaat voor het meten van enkel-armindexen en teendrukmetingen.
Vind je het leuk om met verschillende patiÃ«nten te werken en technisch met apparatuur bezig te zijn.
Draag je bij aan het samen blijven leren en verbeteren van de zorg.


Jouw afdeling

Je komt te werken in een leuk en betrokken team binnen de polikliniek Vaatdiagnostiek. Hier werk je nauw samen met drie ervaren vaatlaboranten en twee vaatchirurgen. Daarnaast is er een goede samenwerking met het Wond Expertise Centrum en de bredere polikliniek Chirurgie.

Een medewerker zegt hierover:

â€œJe komt te werken in een leuk team. Met sommige patiÃ«nten bouw je echt een band op, omdat ze vaker over een langere periode langs moeten komen. Het is mooi om te zien hoe een behandeling gewerkt heeft, omdat je mensen ziet voor en na een ingreep. Met sommige patiÃ«nten ben je intensief bezig door lange onderzoeken.â€

De polikliniek Chirurgie bestaat uit een team van tien chirurgen, twee physician assistants, managementassistentes en secretaresses, evenals twaalf doktersassistentes. Verder werken er vaatlaboranten en mammaconsulenten binnen deze polikliniek. Het Wond Expertise Centrum bestaat uit onder andere een wond- en stomaconsulente, wondverpleegkundigen, een stomaverpleegkundige in opleiding, verpleegkundig specialisten en een physician assistant gespecialiseerd in vaatzorg.

De polikliniek Chirurgie heeft spreekuren op twee locaties: in Ziekenhuis Amstelland en op onze buitenpoli in Uithoorn. Tevredenheid van onze patiÃ«nten staat voorop en we zijn continu bezig met het verbeteren van de geleverde zorg.

Wie ben jij?


Je hebt een hbo-opleiding met natuurkunde in je vakkenpakket, zoals Fysiotherapie, MBRT, KNF, Verpleegkunde of Radiodiagnostisch Laborant
Je hebt affiniteit met vaatchirurgie
Je bent goed in de omgang met mensen en stelt patiÃ«nten op hun gemak
Je werkt zelfstandig, accuraat en bent empathisch
Je kunt goed overweg met digitale systemen
Je hebt er geen bezwaar tegen als je werkdag soms iets uitloopt


Wat wij bieden


Een leerwerkplek via Hogeschool Inholland Haarlem
Een contract van 1,5 jaar met uitzicht op een vast dienstverband
Een 24 uur contract (inclusief 1 lesdag per week)
Salaris volgens de cao Ziekenhuizen, afhankelijk van ervaring
Een enthousiast en betrokken team dat je graag begeleidt
Een eindejaarsuitkering (8,33%) en vakantiegeld (8,33%)
Aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals een meerkeuzesysteem (o.a. fietsregeling en reiskostenvergoeding)
Gratis parkeergelegenheid bij het ziekenhuis


Sfeer proeven of meer weten?

Je bent van harte welkom om een dagje mee te lopen! Neem contact op met:

Lilian Havekes, Teammanager poliklinieken Chirurgie, Orthopedie, Urologie, Dermatologie, Wond Expertise Centrum en Vaatdiagnostiek

ðŸ“ž 020 - 755 6067

Enthousiast? Laten we kennis maken!

Klik op de knop â€œSolliciterenâ€ en stuur je cv en motivatiebrief in. Reageren kan tot en met 31 augustus. Je kunt je sollicitatie richten aan de afdeling Recruitment.

Het aanvragen van een VOG maakt onderdeel uit van de selectieprocedure.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. Doorplaatsing van deze vacaturetekst is niet toegestaan.

Title: Big Data & Ai Specialist
Description:
Ben jij een data-gedreven denker met een passie voor AI en automatisering? Wil jij direct bijdragen aan slimmere marketinganalyses Ã©n het efficiÃ«nter maken van ons online marketingteam? Dan hebben wij dÃ© uitdaging voor jou.

Wat ga je doen als Big Data & AI Specialist bij Inventus?


Je ontwikkelt, beheert en optimaliseert dashboards op het gebied van e-commerce
Je vertaalt ruwe data naar actiegerichte inzichten voor onze marketeers en klanten.
Je gebruikt machine learning en AI-tools (zoals LLMâ€™s) om klantgedrag, advertentieprestaties en verkooptrends sneller en beter te analyseren.
Je ontwikkelt slimme prompts, workflows en AI-tools om terugkerende taken sneller en beter op te pakken
Je traint collegaâ€™s in effectief gebruik van AI (zoals ChatGPT, Claude of Gemini) binnen hun dagelijkse werkzaamheden.
Je evalueert interne processen en past automatisering toe waar mogelijk


Wat zoeken we in jou?


Je hebt ervaring met big data, AI-toepassingen en/of prompt engineering.
Je werkt gestructureerd en hebt een sterk analytisch vermogen.
Je kent je weg (of je leert ze snel aan) in tools zoals Python, SQL, Google BigQuery, Looker Studio, GPT-APIâ€™s, of soortgelijke platforms.
Je hebt ervaring in de e-commerce bij voorkeur aan bureauzijde
Je bent proactief, nieuwsgierig en resultaatgericht.


Wat bieden we jou?


Salaris* tussen â‚¬ 3.500 en â‚¬ 4.750 bruto (*afhankelijk van je ervaring en expertise)
Doorgroeimogelijkheden conform salarisschaal in ons functiehuis deze is gebaseerd op de DDA (Dutch Digital Agencies)
30 vakantiedagen
Jaarlijks opleidingsbudget om jezelf te blijven ontwikkelen
Tijd voor Research en Development
Mogelijkheid tot flexibel- en thuis werken
Een jong en gezellig team
Een goede pensioenregeling en een reiskostenvergoeding
Laptop van de zaak
Fietsplan
Vrijdagmiddag borrel vanaf 16.00 uur


Inventus Online

Wij zijn een jong en hecht team dat bestaat uit 20+ gedreven medewerkers die nieuwsgierig zijn naar alles in de wereld van online marketing. Hierin zijn we ambitieus en constant op zoek naar de nieuwste innovaties. We doen er alles aan om onze klanten te helpen hun e-commerce ambities te realiseren en deze naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Daarnaast houden we van gezelligheid en het vieren van onze successen, op vrijdagmiddag tijdens de vrijmibo maar ook tijdens team-uitjes en onze jaarlijkse zomerbarbecue.

Wil je meer informatie over de vacature, werkzaamheden, arbeidvoorwaarden en meer? Neem dan contact met ons op. Stuur ons een berichtje naar hrm@inventus.online met hierin je CV en eventueel een motivatie. Wij nemen daarna zo snel mogelijk contact met je op.

We zijn nieuwsgierig naar jou!
