HTML:
Description

Seven Seas Water Group

Seven Seas Water Group (www.sevenseaswater.com) is a portfolio company owned by investment funds managed by Morgan Stanley Infrastructure Partners ("MSIP"). Headquartered in Tampa, with operations across the U.S., Caribbean, and Latin America, Seven Seas Water Group (SSWG) delivers annually over 20 billion gallons of water to industrial, commercial, governmental, municipal, and hospitality customers. SSWG designs, builds, owns and operates, delivers new facilities, or acquires and upgrades existing facilities, with the goal of optimizing project risk transfer between the public and private sectors. We have more than 200 water and wastewater treatment plants in operations throughout the United States, Caribbean and Latin America. With an outstanding reputation for decentralized water and wastewater treatment solutions, the SSWG "Water-as-a-Service" approach seeks to help solve global water and wastewater infrastructure challenges.

SSWG operates two businesses within the water infrastructure space. Seven Seas Water, which provides water treatment and desalination for governmental, hospitality and industrial customers in United States, Latin America and the Caribbean, and the AUC Group (www.aucgroup.net), which provides decentralized water and wastewater treatment plants for industrial and municipal customers in the United States.

MSIP is a leading global private infrastructure investment platform. Founded in 2006, MSIP has made over 30 investments across its three flagship closed-ended funds. Since inception, MSIP has had more than $13 billion in commitments. For further information about Morgan Stanley Infrastructure Partners, please visit www.morganstanley.com/im/infrastructurepartners.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities Include The Following

  • Supporting project activities from initiation to completion.
  • Procurement activities: issuing purchase and change orders, tracking documentation, and receipt of orders for all components of construction projects.
  • Set up and maintain a detailed project tracking sheet to monitor and track progress for each project.
  • Compile and maintain comprehensive project documentation, project submittals, and operation & maintenance manuals. Responsible for printing and shipping of documents and final O&M manuals at project end.
  • Work in a team environment with Project Manager(s) to ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
  • Work closely with Project Manager(S) and Field Supervisor(s) to ensure coordination of deliveries.
  • Communicate/report and escalate to management any issues as needed.
  • Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively and effectively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance organizational effectiveness.

Requirements

Qualification/Requirements:

  • Excellent internal & external communication skills - both written and verbal.
  • Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office is required; Adobe Acrobat Pro experience is preferred.
  • Ability to work well independently as well as in a team environment.
  • Behave Ethically: Understand ethical behavior and business practices and ensure that your own behavior and the behavior of others are consistent with these standards and align with the values of the organization.
  • Communicate Effectively: Speak, listen and write in a clear, thorough and timely manner using appropriate and effective communication tools and techniques.
  • Ability to work a hybrid schedule (2 days in the office required).

Education/Experience

  • University degree preferred. Experience in Project Administrative in a similar industry is a plus.
  • Spanish speaking is strongly desired.

Candidates must apply through our website, or by sending resumes to Talent@7seaswater.com.

Title: Dev Scientist
Description:
Clinical Development Scientist

Do you want to be part of an inclusive team that works to develop innovative therapies for patients? Every day, we are driven to develop and deliver innovative and effective new medicines to patients and physicians. If you want to be part of this exciting work, you belong at Astellas!

Astellas Pharma Inc. is a pharmaceutical company conducting business in more than 70 countries around the world. We are committed to turning innovative science into medical solutions that bring value and hope to patients and their families. Keeping our focus on addressing unmet medical needs and conducting our business with ethics and integrity enables us to improve the health of people throughout the world. For more information on Astellas, please visit our website at www.astellas.com .

This position is based in Northbrook, IL. Hybrid work from certain states may be permitted in accordance with Astellasâ€™ Responsible Flexibility Guidelines. Candidates interested in hybrid work are encouraged to apply.

Purpose

The Development Scientist will participate in the development of clinical strategies for assigned modalities or indications within the division. This position will work closely with the Global Medical Lead (GML), Operations Lead, Asset Lead, and Development Physician. The role is accountable for the design, implementation, monitoring, and analysis of clinical studies conducted within the assigned program. Development Scientists are expected to perform their responsibilities independently and have core expertise and experience in clinical development to enable increased participation in division and portfolio level initiatives.

Essential Job Responsibilities


Responsible and accountable for activities related to all current and planned clinical trials on assigned development programs (e.g., develop protocols, investigator brochures, CRFs, informed consents, and clinical study reports and review of clinical trial documents, study analyses, and reporting).
Provides expertise to cross-functional team members to synthesize/contextualize data to facilitate discussions and timely decision making.
Serves on the clinical sub-team with Clinical lead, Operations Lead, and Medical Monitor/Development Physician; supports preparation of clinical development plans, site identification and management, and DESC meetings.
Under the guidance of the development physician/med lead, performs medical monitoring activities (e.g., review, analyze, and triage patient data, generate study reports)
Can independently lead working groups and/or sub-team initiatives in support of protocol, disease area, or clinical development plans.
Partners with Clinical lead in preparing for Health Authority (HA) Meetings and assists in addressing HA inquiries.
Together with the clinical lead and Product Responsible Person, prepares analysis for DMC/DSMB/DEC forums or regulatory submissions.
Provides training at investigator meetings and site initiation visits with clinical trial staff, and partners with Clinical Operations and Medical Affairs on enabling appropriate enrollment into clinical studies or registries. Collaborates cross-functionally to create, review, and/or present clinical content at internal or external meetings.
Supports engagement with current and future clinical study sites (e.g., SIVs, investigator meetings, conferences, steering committee, advisory board meetings).
Shows relevant expertise related to Study Data Review and Analysis:
Provides clinical input into statistical planning, data analysis, and interpretation.
Provides clinical leadership and support for publication of data (manuscripts, presentations) and disease- or technology-related scientific publications.
Works closely with operations groups for site and vendor feasibility, trial set up, and data monitoring.
Leads the execution of contracts, particularly for investigator meetings and advisories.
Supports efforts to develop strategic partnerships with Key External Experts (KEEs)
Serves as key partner for the Development Division in assessment of candidates within discovery, identifying opportunities and potential risks in the context of future development strategies based on modality, indication, unmet need, competitive landscape, and clinical characteristics.
May represent clinical development and assist with clinical assessment of new assets for potential in-licensing and acquisition.
Supports strategic initiatives related to assigned molecule(s), CDP, therapeutic area(s), or portfolio, if requested.
Performs other duties as assigned or special projects as required.


This position is typically an individual contributor role, but may have direct reports based on experience, scope, accountabilities and complexity of assigned development programs. If the position has direct reports, will align with Astellas guidelines for span of control and organizational levels.

This position reports to the IO Development Medical Lead/Head of disease area strategy.

Qualifications Required


Advanced degree in a relevant scientific discipline; health science or clinical discipline with typically 7-8 years clinical, scientific/research, pathology, or industry experience; combination of academia and industry is acceptable.
Thorough knowledge and demonstrated expertise in biotechnology/pharmaceutical industry related to clinical drug development (early-stage development through approval) from initial study design, study start-up & execution to regulatory submissions (INDs, BLAs, NDAs) within U.S. and ex-U.S.
Experience in scientific research and/or clinical practice (as evidenced by appropriate qualifications, publications and/or relevant accreditations).
Strong computer skills including MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, MS Teams and MS Project) and in the use of industry-standard software (e.g., electronic data capture systems [RAVE, InForm, etc.]) and proficient in data analysis software (e.g., Excel, SigmaPlot, SPSS, R, etc.).
Strong collaboration and interpersonal communication skills; able to interact with all levels of internal stakeholders and key functional areas including, Regulatory Affairs, Medical Affairs, Clinical Operations, Data Sciences, Research, Translational Science and Pharmacovigilance (PV).
Demonstrated success working with key external stakeholders (e.g., KEEs, investigators, researchers) including presenting/responding to health authorities.
Knowledge of global pharmacovigilance standards and guidance documents. ï‚· Comfortable working in a flexible, dynamically changing and (at times) challenging environment.
Excellent strategic planning, organizational, and verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to exercise sound judgment, tact, diplomacy, and professionalism in all interactions.
Highest level of scientific integrity and impeccable work ethics.
Ability to work independently without significant oversight or instruction to achieve results with a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail.
Able to travel ~25%, with international travel as required.


Preferred


MD., PharmD, or other relevant masterâ€™s degree.
Knowledge and proficiency related to Immuno-Oncology clinical research


Salary Range

$180,000 - $230,000 (NOTE: Final salary could be more or less, based on experience)

Working Environment


At Astellas we recognize the importance of work/life balance, and we are proud to offer a hybrid working solution allowing time to connect with colleagues at the office with the flexibility to also work from home. We believe this will optimize the most productive work environment for all employees to succeed and deliver. Hybrid work from certain locations may be permitted in accordance with Astellasâ€™ Responsible Flexibility Guidelines.


Benefits


Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
Generous Paid Time Off options, including Vacation and Sick time, plus national holidays including year-end shut down
401(k) match and annual company contribution
Company paid life insurance
Annual Corporate Bonus and Quarterly Sales Incentive for eligible positions
Long Term Incentive Plan for eligible positions
Referral bonus program


\

Category Oncology Development

Astellas is committed to equality of opportunity in all aspects of employment.

EOE including Disability/Protected Veterans

Title: Data Scientist for AI Centre of Excellence
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Would you like to be part of a team focused on solving real-world business problems by transforming our approach to how we work with data and AI/machine learning at scale at Danske Bank?

With clear ties to our Forward â€™28 Group Strategy, Group Data & Analytics is now creating the foundation for leveraging data and AI/ML capabilities. We are currently ramping up to build a highly specialised team that partners with our core business and development teams to deliver solutions that elevate data-driven decision-making and add value to our portfolio of existing and new IT applications.

To do so, we have recently established an AI & Data Science team that will empower the organisation to leverage data and AI technologies to deliver business value and benefits.

Not only do we want to build things right, but just as importantly, we want to build the right thingsâ€”which, in the era of AI and all the hype that comes with it, can be a challenge. You will play a key role in striking that balance.

As part of our migration to AWS, you will also be involved in moving to our future Data Science platform to help accelerate the impact of machine learning across Danske Bank. This will happen in close collaboration with peers in other teams across the organisation. You will promote clear directions for standards, best practices, and ways of working with data science as formulated by our team.

Depending on your experience and knowledge, we may offer you different levels of seniority in the role.

Please be informed that interviews will be held in mid-August.

About you:


Hands-on experimentation and proof-of-value in our lab environment
Scope and deliver end-to-end AI solutions
Guide and educate data scientists and data engineers throughout our organisation in relation to both methods and platform/tooling
Cultivate strong relationships with data scientists and business experts across the organisation


You will:


Outcome-oriented with a focus on solving problems
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to bring the right stakeholders together
Curious about product development and technology trends, with a keen interest in knowledge and self-improvement
Strong in mathematics, statistics, and machine learning
Experience with the following or similar technologies: Python, Spark/PySpark, Airflow, SQL, Public cloud providers, particularly AWSD, databricks, FastAPI, MLflow, Monitoring frameworks (g., Prometheus, Grafana), Containerisation (g., Kubernetes, Docker, OpenShift), CI/CD, pipelines, Git/Azure DevOps
Upper-intermediate English skills
Experience with Design Thinking or a similar UX framework would be beneficial


â€œWe believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.â€

We offer:

This position can be located both in Lithuania and Denmark. If the position is located in Lithuania the monthly salary range will be from 2680 EUR to 4020 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package (benefits are only valid for Lithuania the same as the salary ranges) which includes:

Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.


Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits in Lithuania HERE .

Your title in job contract will be Data Scientist.

Curiosity, excitement, teamwork, and a near-obsession with understanding our frontline business are what I believe it will take to co-create the best data and AI solutions for our business. If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Michael Thruesen on LinkedIn , and I will be happy to answer your questions!

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you our new Data Scientist?

AudienceProject is looking for a Data Scientist for our Copenhagen office to support our continued growth.

â€”

Are you an analyst at heart? And do you have an interest in data modelling and programming? Then we have an opportunity for a career in a fast-growing scale-up that directly cooperates with companies such as Meta, Google, Amazon, Netflix, Disney+ etc.

AudienceProject is a leading SaaS company with 100+ employees delivering audience measurement and research solutions to major advertisers, agencies, and publishers across Europe.




Our platform enables clients to better understand the reach of their campaigns across channels, helping them make confident marketing decisions to reach their audiences more effectively.




Embarking on our second decade of audience measurement, we are now looking for a motivated Data Scientist to join our Data Science Research team.




Joining AudienceProject will give you a front-row seat in the rapidly evolving marketing technology sector and an opportunity to work within a respected business, delivering insights about audiences across the world's largest media channels to top-tier clients and some of the worldâ€™s biggest brands.




What you will do

You will be tasked with developing and implementing new methodologies related to both our platform as well as work on bespoke solutions for top-tier clients.




In the Data Science Research team, you will work with nine other team members and have close collaboration with the developers in our Product department. The team is small and dynamic, and there is plenty of room for innovation and good ideas are quickly turned into action.

You will use Databricks notebooks hosted on our cloud servers to interact with S3 for exploratory data analysis, visualizations and modeling. This is done in PySpark (or SparkR) since the vast amounts of data truly require distributed computing.




This role is heavily focused on programming and model development, with approximately 80% programming and 20% math/statistics. While we use standard libraries for utilities, we rarely rely on high-level, pre-built model functions. Instead, our team develops models from first principles, focusing on algorithmic design and mathematical/statistical foundations.

While we appreciate diverse backgrounds, this position is not aligned with business analytics, qualitative research, or linguistics-focused skill sets.




Essential qualifications

You have a Master's degree or higher education in a numerically oriented education (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, etc.). Candidates with a social science background, but specializing in statistics and data analysis, are also welcome to apply.
You have experience with data wrangling and analysis of large datasets and have developed a good intuition for how data can be used to create valuable insights.
You have a solid understanding of classical statistics techniques, for example descriptive statistics, time series analysis, and regression analyses.
You have programming/scripting skills. Our current toolbox includes Python and R. It is an advantage to have good knowledge of at least one of these languages, as the position is primarily programming-oriented.
You are curious, structured, and goal-oriented. You enjoy diving into complex issues but understand that the goal is to find workable solutions.
You can communicate your results in a non-technical manner and understand how to make complex data analysis useful for non-data scientists.

Further qualifications

Experience working with simulations, Bayesian statistics, and classical machine learning models, with a focus on understanding the underlying principles.
Experience with "human-centered" analysis and experience with analysing attitudinal data, such as survey and/or online behavioural data.
An ability to understand the business implications of data and analysis and how to use it to build a strategic story that engages and creates value for customers.
Coding hobby projects. We are interested in seeing what kind of programming related hobbies you have, or what kind of coding projects you have done in your spare time. This can be shared through a link in your CV/Cover letter.

Relevant working experience is viewed as a plus but is not a strict requirement.




What we offer

A unique career opportunity in a fast-growing scale-up full of curious, intelligent and creative people where you can grow as we grow our company.

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and health insurance
Home internet paid
Central Copenhagen office
Hybrid work model
Daily breakfast
Lunch made by an on-site chef
Unlimited snacks, drinks and coffee
Friday bars and quarterly company dinners
International environment
Friendly, supportive and helpful colleagues
Innovative and market-leading products and services
Exposure to a lot of data handling
Technically/commercially challenging tasks
Working directly with some of the most modern and successful companies of our time
Mentorship from thought leaders in the industry




Send us your application

If you can see yourself in the above and want to work for a leading SaaS company, we want to hear from you.




Apply via Linkedin attaching the following into ONE DOCUMENT:

CV
Cover letter
Copy of graduation certificates for both educations, with grade transcripts
Remember to include a reference/link to your coding hobby project in your CV or cover letter, if relevant




Attention: applications and documents sent via email will not be considered.

We are only considering candidates who are already based in Copenhagen, as we are unable to offer relocation support for this position.

You can only apply once to this position through Linkedin, so make sure to have all your documents condensed into ONE document.




The deadline for applications is August 17th, 2025. We will be inviting applicants for interviews on an ongoing basis.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. Weâ€™re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levelsâ€”a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But thatâ€™s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. Weâ€™ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Veo you will get to work on challenging problems and directly contribute to the value created by our AI-driven end-user products.

You will become part of our AI team, which comprises 15 researchers and engineers responsible for all stages in the machine learning lifecycles across different projects - from scoping and defining data annotation tasks to modeling, validation, and deployment. You will be free to determine the directions of the project you work on while also getting feedback and being encouraged to spar with the rest of the team to assist each other in improving and succeeding.

We stay current with the latest research and continuously discuss concepts and ideas in recent papers to assess their relevance to our tasks and product-specific challenges.

We are looking to add yet another ambitious, high-performing junior to senior engineer/researcher with proven experience from real-world machine learning projects to the team. Experience with computer vision is advantageous but not a must.

What you will do:



Train state-of-the-art machine learning models
Write efficient inference pipelines for cloud and edge
Define and supervise data annotation tasks
Improve evaluation schemes to increase understanding of model performance and shortcomings
Contribute to long-term planning and prioritization of tasks




What you will need:



MSc or PhD in a relevant field
Hands-on experience with real-world, large-scale machine-learning projects
Great coding skills
Skilled at both autonomous tasks and contributing to group efforts
Ability to examine details closely and critically




At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology â€“ with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If youâ€™re excited about this role but your experience doesnâ€™t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

Values We Hold at Veo:

Dare - We take initiative, stay curious, and challenge the status quo in our work.

Own it - We drive impact by identifying opportunities, taking responsibility, and confidently executing.

Level up - We embrace growth, continuously learning and shaping our skills.

Play as a team - We collaborate across a diverse organization, leveraging shared insights for stronger outcomes.

Customer Centric - We deliver value by having close partnerships and a deep understanding of our customers (internally and externally)

Weâ€™re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data scientist with a passion for language, logic, and large language models

To support our continued growth and innovation, we are seeking a Data scientist to join our team in Aarhus. This is a unique opportunity to combine your love of language, structure, and data models, to help shape how we use LLMs, and other machine learning technologies in customer-facing solutions.

Who We Are

Founded in a garage in 2016 and now headquartered in the heart of Aarhus, Adversus is a fast-growing SaaS company with a talented team of +50 colleagues. Weâ€™ve established ourselves as a leading provider of cloud-based call center software, serving customers in more than 35 countries across the globe. We build smart, scalable solutionsâ€”and we always seek new ways to work smarter, not harder.

What You Will Be Doing

As our Data Scientist, you will help design, test, evaluate and refine the technologies that drive accurate, useful, and creative outputs from machine learning models. Youâ€™ll collaborate closely with developers, product managers, and customer-facing teams to ensure our AI features are reliable, effective, and aligned with real-world needs.

You will play a critical role in unlocking the full potential of AI across our platform, helping our customers with automated workflows, content creation, quality assurance, and improving their interactions with our platform.

How We See You


A structured thinker with a flair for language and logic
Familiar with tools like OpenAIâ€™s GPT-4, and prompt engineering best practices
Able to package AI interactions in a format suitable for API consumption.
A pragmatic engineer with a solid understanding of technology limits, but also keeping an eye on the opportunities
Comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
Youâ€™re fluent in English, both written and verbal.


Key Responsibilities


Craft, and iterate on effective inputs to power AI-driven features
Collaborate with development teams to integrate AI outputs into product workflows
Evaluate model behavior, identify edge cases, and propose improvements
Maintain libraries and documentation for internal use
Explore fine-tuning, embeddings, and retrieval techniques to improve performance
Stay up-to-date with AI advancements and bring fresh ideas to the team


If youâ€™re a language lover, systems thinker, and AI enthusiast ready to turn creativity into capability, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Responsibilities

Design, develop, train, and evaluate deep learning models (CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.)
Collaborate with data scientists to understand business requirements and translate them into robust ML solutions
Optimize models for inference (e.g., quantization, pruning, ONNX, TensorRT)
Deploy models to production environments (e.g., via REST APIs, edge devices, or cloud platforms)
Conduct data preprocessing, augmentation, and exploratory data analysis
Maintain and improve MLOps pipelines for training, testing, and monitoring
Document experiments, results, and best practices for future reference

Requirements

Proven experience (3+ years) in deep learning and model deployment
Strong proficiency in Python and DL frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Familiarity with model versioning, reproducibility, and experiment tracking (MLflow, Weights & Biases)
Strong understanding of data structures, computer vision or NLP (depending on the project)
Solid background in mathematics/statistics (linear algebra, probability, optimization)
Ability to work independently and communicate clearly in a cross-functional team

Title: Data Scientist 6 Months Contract
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled Senior AI Consultant to join a cross-functional AI initiative within a major financial institution. The role focuses on designing, building, and deploying scalable and reliable AI solutions that address commercial challenges such as recommendation systems, churn prediction, and other advanced use cases.

You will be part of a collaborative, outcome-driven team working across the full AI lifecycleâ€”from ideation and prototyping to industrialization and production deployment.

Key Responsibilities


Co-design and develop end-to-end AI solutions with internal teams
Work with complex business problems and turn them into technical use cases
Build, test, train, and deploy machine learning models in production environments
Engage with stakeholders across the full AI lifecycle
Act as a technical advisor and solution enabler within the team



Must-Have Skills & Qualifications


Deep knowledge of the AI/ML tech stack and advanced ML techniques
Full lifecycle experience: from proof-of-concept to production-ready models
Proven delivery record of AI use cases in large enterprises
Hands-on experience working in regulated environments (e.g., banking, insurance)
Background in solution-focused consultancy roles
Excellent communication, storytelling, and stakeholder management skills
5+ years of professional experience in data science / machine learning
Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) in computer science, machine learning, applied mathematics, or similar field
Fluent in English (written and spoken)



Nice-to-Have


Experience with financial services, though not mandatory
Familiarity with AI governance or explainability frameworks



Requirements


Personal Attributes


Solution-oriented and collaborative
Busines


Languages


English

Title: AI & Machine Learning Engineer at new Human-Centered Social Network Startup
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Lifebonder, weâ€™re on a mission to break social media addiction, fake personas, cyber-bullying, cancel culture, and loneliness by providing a Mesaverse that lives up to the promise of what social media can be: A safe place to facilitate human connections rather than replace them.

We want to make the world a better place by filling a growing need for direct socializing outside social media - connecting people in friendships that are human, profound, and meaningful. LifeBonder makes it easy for people to connect in a deeper reality through shared spaces, values, and goals because our vision is to build social bonds in real life.

Job brief

We are actively searching for a talented and experienced AI and Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to join our team.

As an AI and Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in the development and implementation of cutting-edge artificial intelligence.

Your responsibilities will involve designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating systems.

In order to thrive in this position, you must possess exceptional skills in statistics and programming, as well as a deep understanding of data science and software engineering principles.

Your ultimate objective will be to create highly efficient self-learning applications that can adapt and evolve over time, pushing the boundaries of AI technology. Join us and be at the forefront of innovation in the field of machine learning.

Responsibilities


Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate AI models and ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning application according to requirements
Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
Run machine learning tests and experiments
Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
Train and retrain systems when necessary
Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
Keep abreast of developments in the field


Requirements And Skills


Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or similar role
Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
Deep knowledge of math, probability, statistics and algorithms
Ability to write robust code in Python, Java and R
Familiarity with machine learning frameworks (like Keras or PyTorch) and libraries (like scikit-learn)
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work in a team
Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
BSc in Computer Science, Mathematics or similar field; Masterâ€™s degree is a plus


What We Offer


We are a small team of endlessly dedicated developers offering a fun and friendly work environment where everyone is equal.
We offer real-world work experience and exciting challenges where you can make a real difference.
Excellent recommendations and when youâ€™re ready to move on, weâ€™ve got your back.
Full-time hires at a later date.

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Drive meaningful change

At our Data & Analytics department, we specialize in data visualizations, BI tools, analytical consulting, statistics, forecasting, and modern data platforms. Working closely with various departments across Abacus, we combine our analytical expertise with a deep understanding of pharmaceutical marketsâ€”from product development to delivery.

We believe that robust Data Science and AI can give Abacus Medicine a competitive edge, uncovering trends and behaviors that drive smarter decision-making. Our advanced machine learning techniques transform complex market data into actionable forecasts. Join us on our growth journey and help shape the future of the pharmaceutical industry.

Get a glimpse of our world

The Data Science team consists of five highly skilled professionals, all dedicated to improve global healthcare through better access to medicine by delivering critical data and insights that drive informed decision-making.

In this role, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teamsâ€”including data analysts, data engineers, product managers, and key business stakeholdersâ€”to develop data-driven solutions that scale.

Are you ready to embark on this journey with us?

As a Data Scientist, you will play a key role in developing and deploying machine learning models that power business insights and operational efficiencies and support tactical and strategic decision-making across Abacus Medicine.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Design, develop, and deploy advanced models, including machine learning, deep learning, and algorithmic solutions, to solve complex business problems.
Analyze datasets to generate actionable insights, ensuring data-driven decision-making.
Design and maintain scalable MLOps pipelines for seamless model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Promote best practices in Data Science by optimizing workflows and expanding the DS/ML toolbox with tools that enhance model accuracy, runtime, and maintainability.
Strengthen our technical infrastructure by integrating modern technologies that enhance efficiency, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
Drive innovation by evaluating and integrating emerging ML/AI methodologies, including LLMs, to enhance model performance.
Translate complex model results into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Share expertise through knowledge sharing and sparring sessions.
Proactively identify potential data science applications for value creation.
Contribute to branch development initiatives and long-term planning, including roadmap definition.


Fuel for your success in the role

We Imagine You Have


Masterâ€™s degree in a data science-related field (e.g., computer science, cognitive science, IT, mathematics/statistics, economics).
Advanced Python programming skills.
Proficient in Data Science skills â€“ ML frameworks (scikit-learn, deep learning frameworks), data wrangling, data analysis, and visualization.
Experienced with the following technologies: SQL, Web APIs, Git, Linux commands.
Excellent English communication skills with the ability to present complex data clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Show genuine care for both team dynamics and the success of the organization, fostering a positive and inclusive work culture.


Preferred Qualifications


Prior working experience in applying data science, with a focus on machine learning and predictive modeling.
Familiarity with the following technologies: MLOps, Spark, Cloud platform (e.g. Azure/AWS), mlflow, ETL processes, CI/CD processes.
Databricks environment for building and deploying ML models.
Leveraging LLMs for enhancing the performance of ML models through prompt engineering and embeddings.


Interested?

If you want to apply for the position, please follow the link and attach your CV.

To help us better understand your motivation and qualifications for this role, we kindly encourage you to attach both your cover letter and academic transcript. This will give us a clearer overview of your interests and the courses you have completed during your studies.

If you have any further questions about the role, please do not hesitate to contact the hiring manager,

Mihai Popovici, Advanced Analytics, Data Science & Tech Lead at mihai.popovici@abacusmedicine.com

Would you like to know more about us?

Follow us on Instagram and LinkedIn and get an insight into everyday life at Abacus Medicine. For job openings, check our Career page.

Moving Healthcare. Moving You.

In Abacus Medicine Group, youâ€™ll experience the power of Moving Healthcare. With our change mindset, we're moving the industry and improving healthcare as we broaden access to medicine.

But it's not just about moving healthcare, it's about Moving You. Youâ€™ll be part of a caring community of more than 1,500 people across the World. With us, you will be valued, empowered, and have a direct impact on driving change. Let's access the future of medicine and make a difference together. Your move.

Please note that the position will remain open until we find the right candidate, after which the job advertisement will be removed. We encourage interested applicants to submit their applications as early as possible.

Please note that due to the upcoming summer holiday period, the recruitment process may take slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and understanding.

Title: Data Scientist PredAI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast â€“ and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. Weâ€™re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together â€“ and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, youâ€™ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions â€“ and that we imagine you share with us.

What youâ€™ll be doing:


Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards


The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:


MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling.
At least 2 yearsâ€™ experience developing machine learning solutions in python, with a focus on model validation and explainability in a production grade system.
Exposure to multiple predictive AI projects, either through work or Kaggle or similar.
A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.


It would be ideal if you also:


Experience from working on AWS
Experience developing production grade code


What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, itâ€™s to take their career to the next level. For others, itâ€™s to break new ground within their area of expertise â€“ in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model â€“ we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, youâ€™re welcome to contact BjÃ¶rn Hertzberg (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com)

The recruitment process consists of the following steps:


Preliminary CV selection
Phone conversation with the recruiter
Online interview with the hiring leader
Background check


We enable dreams and aspirations for a greater good.

We build relationships. We add a personal touch to everything we do â€“ when advising our customers, collaborating with colleagues, and meeting our potential candidates.

We learn and develop. We take pride in being experts and thinking ahead. We use our expertise to meet our customersâ€™ needs, from the simplest to the most complex. We bring a growth mindset to our work that enables us to focus on a broader perspective in our daily challenges.

We lead change. We are responsible and aware of the impact of our decisions, both for our customers and for our local and global communities. Mindful of our responsibility towards current and future generations, we have made sustainability an integrated part of our business strategy.

We are Nordea. We have a 200-year history of supporting and growing the Nordic economies and our values are deeply rooted in these open, progressive and collaborative societies. As one of the biggest employers in the Nordics, Poland and Estonia, you have excellent opportunities to evolve, develop and move forward with us.

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.

HTML:
Job ID: 30617

We are looking for multiple data scientists or machine learning engineers focusing on generative AI for text, and Large Language Models.

At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast â€“ and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. Weâ€™re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together â€“ and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, youâ€™ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger.

About This Opportunity

Meet the AI & Machine Learning team. Our role is to improve how we detect and investigate financial crime with the help of AI and machine learning, to keep our customers, Nordea and society safe.

Our team is about 25 people working out of Stockholm, Helsinki and Copenhagen as a part of the group financial crime prevention (GFCP) unit that provides financial crime prevention services to all of the bank.

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in how we work and how we make decisions â€“ and that we imagine you share with us.

What youâ€™ll be doing:

  • Prototype and explore the feasibility of new AI use cases in collaboration with business stakeholders
  • Implement, deploy, and monitor our AI applications
  • Rigorously evaluate and improve the quality of our AI applications
  • Keep up to date with the latest AI developments to shape our Gen AI best practices and tooling
  • Document models and processes to ensure compliance and meet our compliance and risk management standards

The role is based in Stockholm; Helsinki.

Who You Are

This is the right role if you have a passion to solve challenging problems - with the help of data, software and AI. As a person, you look past the noise, to do what is right. You prefer action to talking, but when you talk, people want to listen.

Your experience and background:

  • MSc or PhD in a field related to predictive or statistical modelling.
  • At least 2 yearsâ€™ experience developing machine learning solutions in python, with a focus on model validation and explainability in a production grade system.
  • Exposure to multiple predictive AI projects, either through work or Kaggle or similar.
  • A knack for tackling complex problems and creating simple solutions.
  • Strong interpersonal communication and presentation skills, explaining complex ideas and technology across domains.

It would be ideal if you also:

  • Experience from working on AWS
  • Experience developing production grade code

What We Offer

People come here when they want to get somewhere. For some, itâ€™s to take their career to the next level. For others, itâ€™s to break new ground within their area of expertise â€“ in other words, with us, you will always move forward.

A culture that fosters performance and growth in one of the largest Nordic banks, offering various opportunities to evolve, develop and learn from brilliant colleagues with diverse backgrounds in a vibrant working environment.

Hybrid working model â€“ we believe in the value of bringing people together and at the same time we embrace the freedom of flexibility.

Diversity and inclusion are a natural part of our daily work. We know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable one. We genuinely believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us stronger together. Every day we strive to find new ways to improve diversity and inclusion within our community e.g. we have signed the European Diversity Charters in the countries where we operate to show our commitment and engage with others to continue learning and improving.

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 08/08/2025. For more information, youâ€™re welcome to contact BjÃ¶rn Hertzberg (bjorn.hertzberg@nordea.com)

  • Preliminary CV selection
  • Phone conversation with the recruiter

  • Background check

Title: Process Data Scientist
Place: HillerÃ¸d, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are looking for a Process Data Scientist to help us translate our manufacturing and supporting processes pain points, into first class Manufacturing Intelligence Use Cases via data analytics /science. If you thrive by being a key stakeholder in establishing the siteâ€™s process data, then you just might be a great colleague to our highly skilled Process Analytics organization.

Your New Role

The Process Data Scientist is a critical role within FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) as the business is expanding and we are introducing new technologies, programs, and customers continuously â€“ with data excellence being one of the mission enablers. We will provide ongoing support to our new site in Holly Springs, NC, USA.

You will be a key stakeholder in establishing the siteâ€™s process data usage and analytics value chain, whilst being the owner of already validated monitoring applications, e.g., an electronic chromatogram review setup and machine learning batch performance models. We continuously strive to identify opportunities to improve internal systems and practices, as well as provide direction and development of digital/data offerings to our partners.

Your Primary Tasks Will Be


Support process investigations, root cause analysis, optimization with data support and analysis
Process Analytics systems support to manufacturing across all product modalities
Develop, validate, and deploy ETL pipelines and help build the process data ecosystem
Support process trending, continued process verification (CPV) and annual product reviews (APQR)
Support development of applications with models for process characterization and scale-up/out
Develop, validate, and deploy multivariate batch monitoring models
Support innovation and systems improvement initiatives in the Process Analytics space



The Skills & Knowledge We Hope You Possess


You have a masterâ€™s degree in in a relevant science or engineering discipline (i.e., Engineering, Bioinformatics or similar) with 2 years of industry experience or a Bachelors in the same area with 4 years of industry experience.
You have working-knowledge of SQL and a solid understanding of data science and the Python data science ecosystem (NumPy, SciPy, pandas, Scikit-learn, Jupyter Notebook).
Familiarity with SIMCA-online, TIBCO Statistica, Visual Basic and Git version control are a plus.
It would be considered an advantage if you also have GMP experience, having worked on delivering GxP applications.



We value candidates who are naturally curious, greet people with a smile, and possess a can-do attitude. You demonstrate humility and respect for those around you. As someone who is pragmatic and structured, you have a keen focus on quality and enjoy working independently. You are proactive in dynamic entrepreneurial environments. Most importantly, you possess strong communication skills and appreciate the support of a cross-functional team.

The team

The Process Analytics team is embedded in the Process Science (PS) organization and provide leadership and subject matter expertise to existing production-ready process data business processes, while also seeking to develop and introduce new Manufacturing Intelligence in clinical, PPQ and commercial processes primarily in the large-scale Cell Culture manufacturing.

We are a growing team of highly professional dedicated scientists/engineers with data management and data science expertise - but also broad experience within pharmaceutical development and manufacturing of monoclonal antibodies.

The work environment is international and informal. The role is based in our HillerÃ¸d, Denmark location, and we offer a flexible work arrangement where a defined number of working hours can be carried out in the employeeâ€™s home.

We keep a high pace and focus on a vital work life balance while having fun. We put a strong emphasis on psychological safety through trust and empowerment within our teams and hope that this is something that speaks to you as well.

Application

Has this sparked your interest, then please upload your CV and cover letter as soon as possible, as we screen candidates on a continuous basis and call in for interviews.

The Company

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies is an industry-leading Biologics Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in HillerÃ¸d, Denmark, Teesside, UK, RTP, North Carolina and College Station, Texas, USA. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the worldâ€™s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcareâ€™s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customersâ€™ products â€“ enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologic, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion. We fuel one anotherâ€™s passion, help accelerate progress, expand capabilities, strengthen innovation, and improve processes to improve lives.

We offer the chance to be part of a global workplace where passion, drive and commitment are met with opportunities for professional and personal development. Deeply committed to diversity and inclusion, we ensure that everyone no matter their background or gender has an opportunity to develop. We take pride in enriching our communities, caring for our environment, and cultivating a world of opportunity for future generations.

We aim to foster a collaborative, innovative and rewarding environment, where diverse perspectives and people come together united by a common purpose and shared values. We pursue our fullest potential as individual contributors and team members. We strive to be the employer of choice and offer a competitive compensation and benefit package.

FUJIFILM Biotechnologies Denmark (FDBD) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identify or any other protected class.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: AI Engineer - Drive Innovation in a AI first company!
Description:
Fullstack AI Engineer | Pioneering AI and AI Agents!




What Youâ€™ll Do

We're a fast-moving team transforming financial operations and compliance using production-grade AI. This isn't a research lab, it's about building and shipping real tools that automate the hard stuff and make systems smarter, faster, and more reliable.




You will:

Build internal and external AI agents that automate workflows like invoice validation, reconciliation, KYC/AML checks, and compliance monitoring.
Use tools like GPT-4o, LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to create end-to-end automations.
Translate deep domain knowledge from finance and legal into prompt-driven tools, backend logic, and APIs.
Connect your work to our core platform using REST APIs, webhooks, and third-party integrations.
Work closely with product and compliance teams to identify high-value use cases and execute fast.
Document and test your automations to ensure they scale across multiple clients and jurisdictions.
(Optionally) Build user interfaces with Retool, Lovable, or React to expose agent functionality.




Who You Are

You have 2â€“4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
Youâ€™ve built real AI-powered systems, agents, automations, wrappers, or workflows that do something useful.
You're confident with Python or JavaScript/TypeScript, and experienced with REST APIs and database development.
Youâ€™ve used tools like LangChain, GPT/OpenAI, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them into working systems.
You enjoy solving real problems, shipping fast, and iterating based on feedback.
You understand how systems interact â€” tools, prompts, logic, APIs, and data flows.
Bonus: experience with finance, compliance, ERP integrations, or process-heavy industries.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI use cases, not demos or sandbox projects.
Join a small, highly capable, and product-driven team.
Ship and own projects that impact large, operationally complex organizations.
Help define how AI is used in an industry begging for modernization.
Enjoy a remote-first culture, fast decision-making, and real ownership over your work.




Tech Stack You'll Touch

LLMs: GPT-4o, OpenAI Functions, Claude
Frameworks: LangChain, n8n, Supabase
Languages: Python, Node.js, TypeScript
Data & APIs: REST APIs (internal and external)
Frontend (optional): Retool, Lovable, React
Cloud: Multi-cloud (flexible based on context)




Compensation

Competitive salary tailored to your experience
Remote within Denmark
Autonomy and a flat structure
Pioneer AI and AI Agents internally!
Optional access to co-working space or office (e.g. Aarhus, Copenhagen)




Ready to build real AI systems that matter? Apply now and help us automate the future of financial operations!




Please reach out to the hiring manager if you have any questions:

Luqman Mohammed-Brown - +45 88 74 11 43 / L.Mohammed-brown@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python Engineer) - AI Trainer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Python developer who enjoys building tools, environments, and infrastructure for working with LLM-based agents. You'll help create sandboxes, task systems, and CI/CD pipelines to support testing and development of AI agents. You'll also work closely with researchers and domain experts, helping them set up and use these tools effectively.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Sandboxes for running and testing AI agents safely
Tools for writing tasks and test cases for agents
CI/CD pipelines to run checks and evaluate agents
Dev environments for experts creating these tasks
Repo templates and scripts to help new contributors
Interfaces for tracking task input and agent results
Example Tasks


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have 5+ years of experience writing Python code
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more

Title: Data Scientist - Economic Consultant for leading brands
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Join a growing team of Data Scientists transforming marketing for some of the world's largest brands

Join a team of expert Data Scientists and Consultants at Choreograph, a WPP Media company, revolutionizing marketing for the world's biggest brands. We transform data into powerful solutions for complex media and marketing challenges, leveraging cutting-edge techniques like econometrics, experiments, and strategic consulting. At Choreograph, you'll be at the forefront of industry innovation, partnering with leading advertisers, publishers, and tech companies to shape the future of marketing. This role offers unparalleled opportunities for professional and personal growth.

What You Will Do

As a Data Scientist on our team, you will:


Develop and implement data-driven solutions for various projects, including econometric modeling, attribution analysis, experimental design, algorithm development, and other data science initiatives.
Analyze large datasets, extract actionable insights, and package findings into compelling presentations for clients.
Collaborate with project teams to drive the development of automated reporting, algorithms, and other data science deliverables.
Contribute to a culture of innovation and continuous improvement within the team.


What You Will Bring


A strong academic background in mathematics, statistics, or a related field (e.g., cand.merc.(mat), cand.polit, Master's in Mathematics).
Proven experience or academic projects demonstrating proficiency in regression analysis and econometric modeling.
Proficiency in statistical software such as R and Python.
Experience with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is advantageous but not required.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive and entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Fluency in English; Danish language skills are highly desirable.


Why Choreograph?


Impactful Work: Contribute to innovative projects that directly impact the success of leading brands.
Growth Opportunities: Develop your skills and advance your career within a supportive and collaborative environment. Gain exposure to cutting-edge technologies like cloud computing, machine learning, and automated data activation.
Dynamic Culture: Join a fun, casual, and social team that values collaboration and work-life balance. Enjoy regular social activities - from padel tennis and functional training to Friday afternoon socials.
Mentorship & Training: Benefit from ongoing training and mentorship from experienced colleagues.


About Us

At Choreograph, a WPP Media company, we are a team of passionate data experts driving real-world results in marketing effectiveness, customer insights, econometric modeling, and digital transformation.

Our Data Science team thrives in a collaborative environment with a vibrant social culture. You will get excellent training from day one and have opportunities to expand your skillset in cutting-edge areas like custom algorithms, cloud technology, and machine learning. We value a supportive and social atmosphere and believe in continuous learning and development within a fun, friendly team.

This is a full-time, permanent position based in Copenhagen, with a three-month probationary period. Apply now with your CV, cover letter and Grades

Contact

For questions about the position, please contact Marc GrÃ¼n, Data Science Director, at marc.grun@Choreograph.com. (Please submit applications through the official channels, not via email).

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe youâ€¦


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
Youâ€™ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion â€“ your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen, sch@dalux.com.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Daluxâ€™ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the worldâ€™s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing
