Title: AI Solutions Developer
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go we aim to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. 40% of all the food produced in the world is wasted, with a big impact on the planet: 10% of greenhouse gas emissions worldwide come from food loss and waste.

Too Good To Go operates the worldâ€™s largest B2C marketplace for surplus food. Through our app we connect businesses that have unsold, surplus food with consumers who can buy and enjoy it at a reduced price. We are a mission-driven certified B Corp.

Weâ€™re growing fast: Our community of over 124 million registered users across 19 countries has already saved more than 473+ million meals from going to waste - together avoiding more than 1.278.000 tonnes of CO2e from entering the atmosphere.

In 2023, Apple recognised Too Good To Go as Winner at the annual App Store Awards, for our appâ€™s exceptional user experience and profound impact on society.

We always look for talented people with diverse backgrounds to join our team. Right now, weâ€™re recruiting our very first AI Solutions Developer!

Your mission

As our AI Solutions Developer you will design and implement artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) solutions that automate and optimize our commercial business processes, with the aim of driving Sales efficiency. You will partner with stakeholders across commercial, product and engineering teams to identify opportunities for process optimization by leveraging AI, and lead the design, testing and scaling of solutions, while ensuring alignment with technical standards, security, and compliance requirements.

You will tackle specific business challenges in our sales operations on a project basis, and leverage your deep knowledge of AI tools in the market to develop MVP solutions, and embed these into the daily sales processes.

By combining your technical skills and commercial understanding, you will help our sales teams across 19 countries work more effectively, spend time on what matters, ultimately leading to more food saved. This role will be based in Copenhagen and reports to our Chief Commercial Officer.

Role Description


Opportunity Identification: You will be gathering context of existing sales processes to assess key opportunities for automation and AI/ML solutions in our operations, challenging current setups, and being a sparring partner to the rest of the Global Commercial teams and broader organization.
Solution Design & Architecture: You will lead the end-to-end selection and design of AI/ML systems for commercial teams, from requesting data pipelines, selecting the appropriate models to use, sourcing/developing tools and prompts, and deploying and monitoring solutions.
Change Management: Your job is to drive change in the organization, and you will be working with other teams in the Global Commercial function to introduce new AI tools and improve ways of working in our operations for lasting impact.
Stakeholder Collaboration: The work is cross-functional by nature, and you will be engaging with colleagues across the company to map workflows and identify automation opportunities. You will be responsible for translating business needs into powerful technical solutions.
Platform & Tooling Selection: As an internal AI expert, you will be recommending which AI platforms and tools we should leverage in our commercial teams. You will oversee procurement and integration of third-party AI services in the Sales community, in close collaboration with our Tech and Legal teams.
Security & Compliance: You will be expected to comply with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR) and organizational security policies.
Community & Knowledge Sharing. As a domain expert, you will form a community with other data scientists, ML engineers, and developers in the company on AI practices, and be an ambassador of the AI journey across all teams.


Requirements


Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or related field.
Solid experience with business process automation platforms and iPaaS solutions.
Strong understanding of APIs and webhook integrations.
Experience with JSON, data mapping, and transformation.
Proficiency in workflow logic, conditional operations, and error handling.
Experience designing and implementing automated workflow solutions using modern workflow automation platforms (such as Make.com, N8N, Zapier, or similar tools)
Strong AI prompting skills, experience leveraging APIs to connect data sources, and building MVP solutions.
Experience with project and change management, preferably from introduction of new tech solutions.
Good understanding of sales processes, preferably in a B2B environment.


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: Weâ€™re proud of the change weâ€™re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Offer


A rare opportunity to work in a global social impact company and certified B Corporation, where you can see real and tangible impact in your role.
Work alongside an international community of users, partners and 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries on the same important sustainability mission.
Personal and professional development in a fast-paced scale-up environment.
An inclusive company culture where you can bring your authentic self to work.
A strong, values-driven team culture where we celebrate success and socialise with colleagues that care.


Benefits


Work Flexibly
Enjoy hybrid working from our great offices, at home or abroad.
Extra parental leave and days off beyond local legislation and the option to take an extra week of unpaid leave
Health insurance and pension plans (subject to country of employment).
Additional days off for significant life events
Celebrate and Socialise
Regular social events like summer and winter parties.
Coffee, snacks and fully-equipped kitchens.
Get to know our community with a monthly free Surprise Bag.
Paid volunteer time through our Shareback volunteering programme
Women in the Workplace, P.R.I.D.E., People of Colour and Functionally Diverse Employee Resource Groups

How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, itâ€™s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when weâ€™re allowed to be ourselves, and weâ€™re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.

Title: Senior Front-end Developer, Business Intelligence
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Weâ€™re looking for a Power BI Specialist with a passion for leveraging data to drive business transformation.

What you will do

Based in Copenhagen, you will help clients across Europe harness the full potential of their data through interactive dashboards, robust data models, and actionable analytics. While you will play a key role in advising and guiding clients on high-level strategies, your primary focus will be on hands-on Power BI development and deployment.

In This Role, You Will


Develop and optimise Power BI dashboards
Translate complex business requirements into well-structured data models
Build interactive Power BI dashboards that provide clear insights and foster data-driven decision-making
Implement best practices for data modelling, DAX calculations, and performance optimisation
Integrate data from multiple sources
Work with diverse data sets â€“ spanning on-premises and cloud environments â€“ to create unified, user-friendly views
Establish and maintain robust data pipelines, ensuring reliability and scalability
Consult on data and analytics strategy
Collaborate with clients to define their data and analytics goals, aligning Power BI solutions with broader business objectives
Provide input on governance, architecture, and ethical considerations for data-driven initiatives
Support AI-driven insights
Partner with AI specialists to embed predictive analytics and machine learning outputs into Power BI dashboards
Advise on data readiness for AI projects and ensure the seamless integration of AI-driven insights
Drive stakeholder engagement
Gather requirements, offer training, and conduct workshops to upskill clients on Power BI usage
Present findings and strategic recommendations to executive teams and business leaders
Project management
Coordinate tasks, timelines, and deliverables using structured methodologies
Communicate progress effectively to both internal teams and external stakeholders

What youâ€™ll bring

Weâ€™re Looking For Individuals With


Technical expertise
Hands-on experience in Power BI development (data modelling, DAX, and visualisation best practices)
Familiarity with SQL, Python, or other relevant languages is a plus
Analytical mindset
Proven ability to translate business requirements into data solutions
Comfort working with complex data sets and deriving actionable insights
Communication skills
Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills
Fluency in English (Danish is a plus), with the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Consultative approach
Some experience (or strong interest) in management consulting, ensuring you can advise on strategic data initiatives as well as deliver hands-on solutions
Flexibility and mobility
Willingness to travel within Europe to collaborate with diverse clients and teams

What we offer?

Role

Working with The Tech Collective is your key to doing impactful work and contributing directly to transformative data initiatives in leading organisations across Europe. On top of that, this role will also give you plenty of opportunity to thrive in:


Professional growth
Engage in internal training, workshops, and keynotes to deepen your expertise in Power BI, data strategy, and emerging AI trends
A dynamic culture
Join an international consulting firm that values curiosity, collaboration, and a drive for excellence
Supportive environment
Thrive in a culture of trust, autonomy, and continuous learning, where your insights and creativity are highly valued

We look forward to hearing from you and exploring how your Power BI expertise can help our clients unlock the true potential of data, analytics, and AI!

Apply Now

Send us your resume and a brief cover letter highlighting your Power BI experience.

We will be conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as applications will close once the position is filled.

We look forward to hearing from you!

While you will play a key role in advising and guiding clients on high-level strategies, your primary focus will be on hands-on Power BI development and deployment.

In This Role, You Will

  • Develop and optimise Power BI dashboards
    • Translate complex business requirements into well-structured data models
    • Build interactive Power BI dashboards that provide clear insights and foster data-driven decision-making
    • Implement best practices for data modelling, DAX calculations, and performance optimisation
  • Integrate data from multiple sources
    • Work with diverse data sets â€“ spanning on-premises and cloud environments â€“ to create unified, user-friendly views
    • Establish and maintain robust data pipelines, ensuring reliability and scalability
  • Consult on data and analytics strategy
    • Collaborate with clients to define their data and analytics goals, aligning Power BI solutions with broader business objectives
    • Provide input on governance, architecture, and ethical considerations for data-driven initiatives

  • Drive stakeholder engagement

    • Present findings and strategic recommendations to executive teams and business leaders
  • Project management
    • Coordinate tasks, timelines, and deliverables using structured methodologies
    • Communicate progress effectively to both internal teams and external stakeholders
What youâ€™ll bring

Weâ€™re Looking For Individuals With

  • Technical expertise

  • Analytical mindset
    • Proven ability to translate business requirements into data solutions
    • Comfort working with complex data sets and deriving actionable insights
  • Communication skills
    • Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills

Role

Title: AI Student
Place: Nordborg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
The Impact You'll Make
Are you curious about Artificial Intelligence and excited to explore how it shapes real-world solutions? Weâ€™re looking for a motivated and open-minded Student Worker to join our AI and Machine Learning ML) team. Youâ€™ll work with engineers and project managers to explore, test, and contribute to innovative AI projects. Whether youâ€™re an advanced student or just starting out, this is a hands-on opportunity to learn, grow, and make an impact in a dynamic and supportive environment.

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

Help collect, label, and prepare data for AI and ML experiments
Explore and test ML models with guidance from experienced professionals
Participate in documenting results, sharing findings, and refining ideas
Participate in team meetings, code reviews, and knowledge sharing sessions
Support small research assignments or investigations into new AI methods.

Enjoy thinking about complex problems and investigating them with others?

Enjoy working with others and sharing knowledge.
Want to develop your skills in a supportive and learning-focused environment.

A hands-on role on real AI projects â€“ with room to explore and learn
Mentorship and feedback from experienced team members

The chance to contribute to innovative products and ideas that matter

Title: ML/AI Engineer - Tax Automation & Agentic Platform
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At EY, weâ€™re all in to shape your future with confidence.

Weâ€™ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

About The Job

At the EYâ€™s digital product organization, you will be building intelligent tax automation tools and agentic AI platforms for increased efficiency, quality, and joy in tax and compliance workflows.

We help thousands of clients with services such as producing correct and compliant tax filings, and consulting multinational companies on how to navigate the international tax landscape.

To do those jobs with the highest degree of accuracy and efficiency, intelligent automation and great AI-powered software play key roles.

We operate across the Nordics (DK, FI, SE, NO) with a small, flat, and informal organization of ~40 engineers, designers, researchers, and PMs. In a distributed setup across all countries where we work from home and offices depending on preferences and needs.

Tax? Yes, tax filings and tax law are the domains we design and build for, so having an interest in those areas would be good. Actual experience and domain knowledge is of course a plus, but certainly not a requirement. It's a pretty small Venn diagram of ML engineers who also have professional tax experience.

Above all, we value working with good all-round people. People who are both highly specialized but are capable of collaborating across disciplines.

About You

As an ML/AI engineer, you will be entrusted with building intelligent automation systems and agentic AI platforms across several business-critical tax products.

As a master of your craft, you will develop production-ready ML models, NLP pipelines, and AI agents using Python, Langchain, and modern transformer architectures.

Solutions that are well-tested, documented, optimized for performance, and easy to maintain.

You have honed those skills by working on ML applications in cross-functional product teams, where you have shown yourself as a wonderful collaborator who can translate business requirements into intelligent technical solutions.

You have likely also done many model reviews and taken initiative to question AI approaches suggested by people more senior in the company than yourself. And challenged product decisions that didn't make technical sense from an ML perspective.

If that sounds like you, we should talk. In the meantime, here's more information about the work and our team.

Your Key Responsibilities


Building intelligent tax automation systems using ML/AI technologies
Developing agentic AI platforms for Nordic tax regulations and compliance
Close collaboration with tax professionals, designers, product managers, and fellow engineers
Spending time, occasionally, with users and domain experts to understand tax workflows in detail
Working across a range of products and problem spaces in the tax domain
Freedom to work remotely or in our Copenhagen or Stockholm office


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role, you should have:


ML/AI Fundamentals: Experience with supervised/unsupervised learning, classification, entity extraction, document processing, and time-series analysis
NLP Expertise: Proficiency with transformer models, embeddings, document analysis, and Named Entity Recognition
Python Stack: Strong experience with Langchain, Ragas, OpenAI API, and modern ML frameworks
Production Experience: 2+ years deploying ML models as REST APIs with async processing capabilities
Database Skills: Experience with MongoDB and vector databases, particularly for document and financial data modeling
Cloud Platforms: Familiarity with Azure AI Foundry or similar cloud ML platforms
Security Awareness: Understanding of data privacy, security requirements, and compliance frameworks (SOX, PCI)
Easy access to Copenhagen, Helsinki, or Stockholm. You can work remotely most of the time, but we meet up in person weekly
Really good English speaking and writing skills. That's our work language
An interest in tax law and financial regulations


What We Look For

We obviously want you to be a skilled ML engineer, but we believe that a engineer is so much more than that. We are looking for a colleague who isâ€¦


A real craftsperson and a stickler for technical details
Delightful to be around and able to communicate ML concepts to non-technical stakeholders
A clear communicator who can translate between tax domain experts and technical teams
Supportive and helpful in cross-functional collaboration
Quick to solve complex problems with practical engineering solutions
Questioning AI approaches and decisions before committing to implementation
Eager to learn about both advancing ML techniques and tax domain complexities
Comfortable working in 6-week Shape Up cycles with autonomous project ownership


What We Offer


A tech product team: Digital product organization as a unit operates mostly product- and user-driven, even though we are situated within a large consultancy organization
Direct access to domain experts: Your ML models will directly impact tax professionals who are quite literally right next to you, providing immediate feedback and domain insights
Cutting-edge AI challenges: Work on agentic AI platforms and intelligent automation in a regulated, high-stakes environment
Shape Up methodology: Work in focused 6-week cycles with clear scope and autonomy
Good food and good times: We take good care of the people who dedicate their working hours to our cause
Diverse and inclusive culture: You'll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs


To learn more about EY and what it's like to work here, please follow us on EY Careers, Career blog and social media.

Apply now

Please apply with your CV and Cover Letter. We review applications on a continuous basis so please apply right away, but no later than 11.8.2025. For questions regarding the role, do not hesitate to contact brian.groth@dk.ey.com For any questions regarding the recruitment process, please contact Jakob.Damsted@dk.ey.com.

We look forward to your application.

We plan to do interviews from August 15th to August 22nd and be able to sign the contract in August too.

At EY, weâ€™ll develop you with future-focused skills and equip you with world-class experiences. Weâ€™ll empower you in a flexible environment, and fuel you and your extraordinary talents in a diverse and inclusive culture of globally connected teams. Learn more.

Are you ready to shape your future with confidence? Apply today.

To help create an equitable and inclusive experience during the recruitment process, please inform us as soon as possible about any disability-related adjustments or accommodations you may need.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer - Software, Development Tools and AI
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about application development and excited by the opportunity to shape the future of software engineering with AI? Join Microsoft as aâ€¯Software Solution Engineer â€“ Cloud & AI, where youâ€™ll help enterprise developers solve complex challenges and build the next generation of intelligent applications.

Microsoft is transforming the developer experience by embedding AI across the software development lifecycle. With GitHub and Visual Studioâ€”trusted by over 100 million developers globallyâ€”at the core, and seamless integration with Azure AI, weâ€™re leading the way in â€œAgentic DevOps,â€ where AI agents streamline development and operations. As a Software Solution Engineer, youâ€™ll help customers boost productivity and become AI-native.

The Software Solution Engineer (SE) is a technical sales role focused on helping enterprise developers understand the value of Microsoftâ€™s AI-powered developer stack across every stage of the software development lifecycle. Youâ€™ll work directly with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate GitHub, Visual Studio, and Azure AI Foundry through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, code-with sessions and architecture workshops.

As a trusted technical advisor, youâ€™ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI integration into their development workflows. Whether enabling DevSecOps at a global bank or scaling GitHub Copilot across thousands of engineers, youâ€™ll help customers modernize their SDLC and realize the full value of Microsoftâ€™s developer platform.

Microsoftâ€™s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
Lead hands-on engagementsâ€”hackathons, code-with sessions, and architecture workshopsâ€”to accelerate adoption of Microsoftâ€™s developer tools and cloud platforms.
Build trusted relationships with co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
Maintain deep expertise in GitHub, Github Copilot, Visual Studio, AI-assisted dev tools, Foundry SDK, CI/CD, DevOps (ADO), and cloud-native development (APIs, containers, microservices)
Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in developer communities and customer forums


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (RQs)


Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯ OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯ OR equivalent experience
Experience engaging enterprise development teams, including developers, architects, and technical decision makers.
Proficiency in modern languages like JavaScript/TypeScript, Python, C#, or Java, and frameworks such as .NET, Node.js, or React.
Hands-on expertise with GitHub, Visual Studio Code, CI/CD, DevOps, and platform engineering (e.g., observability, security, performance).
Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
Experience with cloud-native development: APIs, containers, microservices, event-driven design.
Familiarity with AI-assisted tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot), low-code/pro-code platforms, and Azure AI.
Ability to shape technical strategy through thought leadership and community engagement.
Experience aligning technical solutions with business goals in collaboration with sales and partners.
Proficiency in Danish is preferred.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Fullstack AI Engineer â€“ WasteHero
Description:
Help us reinvent municipal infrastructure â€“ with AI.

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies â€“ the backbone of public life â€“ and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools â€“ fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What Youâ€™ll Do


Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.
Document and test your agents so they can scale across customers, countries, and products.

You have 2â€“4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.

You love shipping fast, learning fast, and solving real customer problems.
You think in systems. You see the flow between tools, prompts, users, and data.
Bonus: experience with public infrastructure, tenders, waste, logistics, or ERP systems.

Work on real-world AI problems â€” not gimmicks.

Help define how AI is applied in one of the most operationally complex and underserved domains: waste & city infrastructure.
Enjoy full autonomy, fast feedback loops, and the ability to shape the product and stack.

Help us reinvent municipal infrastructure â€“ with AI.

At WasteHero, we're on a mission to build the most advanced, intelligent municipal software platform in Europe. Our customers are cities and waste companies â€“ the backbone of public life â€“ and we help them digitize operations, optimize resources, and become smarter every day. Now, we're ready to go AI-first. And we need a builder.

We're looking for a Fullstack AI Engineer who can combine classic engineering skills with modern AI tooling to ship real, production-grade AI agents, flows, and tools â€“ fast. This isn't a research role. This is about building things that work.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Build internal AI agents that automate everything from public tender qualification to API-based integration flows.
  • Use OpenAI (GPT-4o), LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to develop real, end-to-end flows.
  • Translate domain knowledge (from product, integration, support) into prompt-based tools, scripts, and interfaces.
  • Develop backend logic and connect with our main platform via REST APIs, webhooks, and Supabase.
  • Collaborate directly with our founder, product team, and engineers to prioritize high-impact use cases.

Title: Cloud & AI Solution Engineer â€“ AI Applications
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you insatiably curious, deeply passionate about the realm of AI & applications, and ready to tackle complex challenges in a dynamic environment? If so, we invite you to join our team as a Cloud & AI Solution Engineer in AI Applications forâ€¯commercial customersâ€¯at Microsoft. Here, you'll be at the forefront of cutting-edge projects that leverage the latest technologies to drive meaningful impact. Join us and be part of a team that thrives on collaboration, creativity, and continuous learning.

Microsoft is transforming the developer experience for AI applications across the development lifecycle. With AI Foundry and seamless integration with Azure AI, weâ€™re leading the way in Agentic AI development where AI agents streamline development and operations. As an AI Apps Solution Engineer, youâ€™ll help customers boost productivity and become AI-native.

As an AI Applications Solution Engineer (SE), you will play a pivotal role in helping enterprise AI developers unlock the full potential of Microsoftâ€™s AI-powered stack across every stage of the development lifecycle. Youâ€™ll collaborate closely with engineering leaders and platform teams to accelerate AI Foundry, Azure AI, and Responsible AI, through hands-on engagements like Proof of Concepts, hackathons, and architecture workshops. This opportunity will allow you to accelerate your career growth, develop deep business acumen, hone your technical skills, and become adept at solution design and deployment. Youâ€™ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications development into their deployment workflows. In summary, youâ€™ll help customers modernize their applications and realize the full value of Microsoftâ€™s AI platform, all while enjoying flexible work opportunities.

As a trusted technical advisor, youâ€™ll guide customers through secure, scalable solution design, influence technical decisions, and accelerate AI applications and agents into their development workflows. In summary, youâ€™ll help customers modernize their applications leveraging AI and realize the full value of Microsoftâ€™s platform.

Microsoftâ€™s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

Responsibilities


Drive technical sales with decision makers using demos and PoCs to influence solution design and enable production deployments.
Lead hands-on engagementsâ€”hackathons, code-with sessions, and architecture workshopsâ€”to accelerate adoption of Microsoftâ€™s developer tools and cloud platforms.
Build trusted relationships with developers and platform leads, co-designing secure, scalable architectures and solutions
Resolve technical blockers and objections, collaborating with engineering to share insights and improve products.
Maintain deep expertise in AI Foundry & App architecture (Agentic AI framework, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI) and App architecture/cloud native dev (APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java or .NET).
Maintain and grow expertise in AI Management & Security (Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, orchestrator, monitoring).
Represent Microsoft through thought leadership in developer communities and customer forums


Qualifications

Required Qualifications (RQs)


Proven years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A few years technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯ OR Master's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field AND A couple year(s) technical pre-sales or technical consulting experienceâ€¯ OR equivalent experience
Expert on full stack App architecture design / modernization and cloud native dev (e.g., APIs, containerization, microservices, event-driven, Python, Java, .NET)
Expert for AI & ML models (e.g., Agentic AI framework, AI Foundry, Semantic Kernel, Foundry SDK, Responsible AI, fine-tuning/inferencing, etc.)
Proven ability to lead technical engagements (e.g., hackathons, PoCs, MVPs) that drive production-scale outcomes.


Preferred Qualifications (PQs)


Several years technical pre-sales, technical consulting, or technology delivery, or related experience OR equivalent experience
Proven years experience with cloud and hybrid, or on premises infrastructure, architecture designs, migrations, industry standards, and/or technology management
Proficient on Agentic framework, AI Management & Security (e.g., Gen AI Ops, Sentinel, Responsible AI, orchestrator, monitoring)
Skilled with 1 or more frameworks, tools, languages (e.g., GitHub, Copilot Studio, VS Code, Jupyter, PyCharm, Node.js, Python, Java, C#, C++, AI Assisted Dev Tools)
Proficiency in Danish is preferred.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)
Company: Department of Pharmacy, University of Copenhagen
Description:
Job portal
All vacancies


Four Data Science Specialists for the Center for Pharmaceutical Data Science Education (CPDSE)

The center for pharmaceutical data science education is a joint effort by seven departments at two universities to raise the data literacy of people discovering, developing and helping the right usage of drugs. We aim to rapidly evolve and integrate data and modelling heavy research into the pharmaceutical education contributing to progressing the cultures and mindsets of people and organizations involved in the pharma value chain. To do this we are creating and joining expertise at the universities and the broader ecosystem. The center aims to be human-centric and characterized by co-leadership and high levels of autonomy and empowerment. Read more at our temporary website (cpdse.ku.dk) also linking to the individual departments (cpdse.ku.dk/about-the-center/participants/)

Of the 4 Data Science Specialists, 1 will be employed and primarily located at the Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU. The 3 other positions will be at UCPH, 1 at Department of Pharmacy and the remaining 2 at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology. This job announcement is posted both at SDU and UCPH. Please apply at both universities if you want to be considered for all four positions, or at the university of your choice, if you only want to be considered at either UCPH or SDU. All applications received at either SDU or UCPH will be evaluated together to select candidates with complementary skills and competences.

Job Description

We are looking for 4 passionate Data Science Specialists to lead the integration of advanced data science techniques into life sciences education, supporting educators and inspiring the next generation of professionals in pharmacy, biology, and chemistry, and other areas in life science. The positions aim to elevate data science skills across students, faculty, and staff while offering a unique pathway for professional growth by collaboration across disciplines, innovation of teaching strategies, and contribution to groundbreaking pharmaceutical research.

As one of the Data Science Specialists, you will be part of a team with complementary expertise, including, among other things, system architects, data/database engineers, data analysts/scientists, and programmers. You will also work closely together with course teams to develop data generation, data analysis, modeling, simulation, and machine learning workflows as well as develop custom data science-related materials for teaching. In addition, you will aid the scientific staff in their day-to-day work in activities related to data science research and education within the Center. Actual teaching of students in practical data science exercises and classroom assignments will also be part of the job. Furthermore, you are expected to take part in organizing workshops and other events for employees to broaden the application and integration of data, code, and computational tools in the research at the departments. Assisting with practical tasks including access to high-performance facilities, server/data management, and alignment with IT departments.

The positions are for 5 years starting as soon as possible with the following possibility of permanent employment.

Profile

Essential Experience And Skills

The ideal candidate should have prior work experience related to research and/or teaching within some field of expertise including Data Science and fulfil many of the below listed requirements:


MSc (or BSc plus minimum of 2-years of work experience) related to data science, bioinformatics, computer science or within natural sciences
Excellent programming skills, preferably in Python and/or R
Good software engineering practices (e.g. git, virtual environments, modular code organization)
Excellent data handling and analysis skills
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, preferentially in both Danish and English
Ability to work and communicate with non-data scientists from different areas
Ability to work collaboratively with a diverse team of specialists
Experience with AI/machine learning


Ideally the final team of 4 data science specialists should between them cover these desirable experience and skills:


Knowledge of the drug discovery and design processes and pharmaceutical sciences in general, including e.g. physics and chemistry
High-level knowledge and experience in working with ML models and in particular neural networks.
Experience with teaching and development of teaching material
Familiar with system administration and integration, Linux and shell scripting
Familiar with high-performance computing environments (e.g. Slurm scheduler)
Experience with GDPR compliance
Experience with database design and management
Knowledge and experience with various publicly available databases related to health, disease and treatment as well as biobanks and registries.
Data engineering and data wrangling (e.g., well-ordered flatfiles, SQL, Spark or similar)
Data storytelling and communication (notebooks, static graphics, dynamic graphics, dashboards, Shiny, Plotly, Streamlit)


Terms of employment

The positions are full-time with an average working week of 37 hours. Salary and other terms and conditions of appointment are set in accordance with the Agreement between the Ministry of Finance and AC (Danish Confederation of Professional Associations) or other relevant professional organizations.

2 positions at Department of Drug Design and pharmacology, UCPH â€“ Jagtvej 160, 2100 KÃ¸benhavn Ã˜

1 position at Department of Pharmacy, UCPH, Jagtvej 160, 2100 KÃ¸benhavn Ã˜

1 position at Department of Public Health, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacy and Environmental Medicine, SDU, Campusvej 55, 5230 Odense

Use the UCPH application system for the Copenhagen-based positions and the SDU application system for the Odense-based position.

Application

The application must be submitted in English and include the following documents:


Application, including motivation for applying for this position (max. 1 page)
Curriculum vitae
Diplomas (Master, PhD, and other relevant certificates)
List of publications, contributions to software projects or similar if relevant
Teaching experience/teaching portfolio, including documentation of any formal qualifications and teaching experience


Practical information

The University of Southern Denmark and the University of Copenhagen encourages all interested in this position to apply. Please submit your application with the required documents. Only online applications will be accepted. The application deadline is Friday 15th, August, 2025, 23.59 p.m. CET.

Interviews for this position are expected to be held on end of August and beginning of December.

For questions about the position, please contact Head of Center, Professor Morten Lindow (UCPH), morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk, or Professor Anton PottegÃ¥rd (SDU), apottegaard@health.sdu.dk.

APPLY NOW

Part of the International Alliance of Research Universities (IARU), and among Europeâ€™s top-ranking universities, the University of Copenhagen promotes research and teaching of the highest international standard. Rich in tradition and modern in outlook, the University gives students and staff the opportunity to cultivate their talent in an ambitious and informal environment. An effective organisation â€“ with good working conditions and a collaborative work culture â€“ creates the ideal framework for a successful academic career.

Contact

Morten Lindow

E-mail: morten.lindow@sund.ku.dk

Info

Application deadline: 15-08-2025

Employment start: Start as soon as possible

Department/Location: University og Copenhagen

Title: AI/ML Intern (Full-time, Fall 2025)
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about shaping the future of artificial intelligence? Do you want to work on real-world product innovations? Join our AI team at Bang & Olufsen, where we translate state-of-the-art machine learning into products that define the future of sound and interaction.

What You Bring

A real passion and interest for Artificial Intelligence. In order to set you up for success as an intern, we also look for the following skills and experience:



Currently enrolled in a Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or Keras.
Demonstrated interest or experience in developing and optimizing algorithms for real-world problems.
Solid understanding of the data lifecycleâ€”from collection to cleaning and model validation.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.



What We Offer

Working with the latest machine learning, artificial intelligence, and signal and information processing technology, you will be involved in the design and development pipeline of innovative artificial intelligence solutions.

You will become part of the Artificial Intelligence Group at Bang & Olufsen in Lyngby, dedicated to pioneering advanced AI research for developing systems ready for market integration that facilitate Bang & Olufsen's hallmark user experiences. We cover almost all fields of machine learning. You will be integrated into a multidisciplinary team composed of both machine learning researchers and engineers. Given AI's broad impact, our efforts intersect various technical domains with a special focus on audio and acoustics, fundamental to our brand. The position also offers the chance to engage with and work alongside a diverse group of specialists within various departments at Bang & Olufsen.

From the very first day of your internship, your mentor will closely guide you throughout your time with us. You will work alongside our engineers as an equal member of our team and therefore have a great impact on different parts of our creative processes.

With approximately 1100 employees, Bang & Olufsen is an agile company that gives room for individual flexibility and decision-making. Our hierarchy is flat, and our communication is open and trustworthy. We believe in mutual respect and with a unique pool of people coming from +55 countries we aim to build a more inclusive workplace to grow as professionals and as a company and remain innovative.

Compensation: Attractive salary and benefits package

Location: Kongens Lyngby, Denmark or Struer, Denmark

Start date: Ideally September 1st, 2025 but we're flexible for a prompt start thereafter

Duration: Approximately 6â€“8 months,full-time

Travel: Approx. 5%

How To Apply

Submit your CV (in English) and grade transcripts by pressing the â€˜Applyâ€™ button. Applications are assessed continuously, so please apply as soon as possible and no later than August 10th 2025. We encourage you to apply as soon as possible; this advert could be close before the stated deadline if we receive a high volume of applications.

At Bang & Olufsen, we believe in equal opportunities for all. We encourage applicants to focus on their qualifications, skills, and experience when submitting their CVs. Please refrain from including personal information such as photographs. Our hiring decisions are based solely on merit, and we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal chance to succeed. If you see yourself in the position and believe you have the potential to support build B&O's future, even if you don't meet all the requirements, we sincerely encourage you to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

Read more about our recruitment process and explore your career opportunities within Bang & Olufsen here.

Bang & Olufsen has, for 100 years, developed luxury audio products that change moods and inspire minds. With offices in Denmark (headquartered in Struer) and the rest of the world, Bang & Olufsen is determined to create products that push the boundaries of audio technology. To this day, every product is still characterized by the unique combination of beautiful sound, timeless design and unrivalled craftmanship.

Title: Machine Learning Scientist
Place: HillerÃ¸d Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Machine Learning Scientist




FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled machine learning scientist with a strong background in deep learning to develop our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.




This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSSâ€™ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately better global usage of limited resources.










Primary tasks




Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for the data chain. You will work in close collaboration with our hardware and software teams as well as marketing organization in taking the data chain from concept to deployment and sales release. In this task, you will be responsible for:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets.
Develop algorithms and data pipelines.
Design experiments to test the data chain.
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets.
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms.




Your daily work will be at the FOSS innovation center in HillerÃ¸d, Denmark.







About you




You hold an M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:

Extensive hands-on experience using deep learning frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Proficient in data science methodologies, including experimental design, statistical analysis, and hypothesis testing, using tools such as Python, Pandas, NumPy, and SciPy.
Experience in machine learning development best-practices and MLOps workflows.
Good understanding of image processing, with practical use of libraries such as OpenCV.
Familiar with optimizing deep learning models for efficient deployment on edge devices and resource constrained environments is a plus.
Previous industry experience in applied machine learning projects is considered an advantage.




We expect you to have an interest in

the full data chain of analytical instruments.
developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers.
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain.










As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. Youâ€™re curious about new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting, incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open-minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.







We offer




We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSSÂ´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D. Foss is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for complex development and career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSSâ€™ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strives at delivering cutting-edge creative algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal and humorous tone.




Application




Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, but due to summer vacation in Denmark, the hiring process will start in week 31! Any questions can be directed to head of machine learning Erik Schou Dreier esd@foss.dk (please note there may be a slight delay in response due to vacation).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, sex, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief.




FOSS

FOSS contributes to the sustainable use of our planetâ€™s agricultural resources and thus to the nutrition and health of the people of the world. We make it our business to build analytical solutions, which add value by improving food quality and optimizing production, from raw material to finished products.

FOSS helps optimize the use of food and agricultural resources by enabling customers to run intelligent data-driven productions with less waste, better quality, bigger yields, and more optimal use of raw materials.

Always at the forefront of analytical technology development, FOSS provides a range of analytical solutions from laboratory to at-line and in-line solutions, across industries from dairy to grain and meat.

FOSS provides instruments and solutions to the worldâ€™s 100 largest food companies and for more than 60 years, FOSS has been innovating analytical technology.

FOSS was founded by Nils Foss in HillerÃ¸d in 1956. We are a family-owned, global company and our products and services are sold all around the world. FOSS employs more than 1,500 highly qualified people worldwide.

Title: AI Engineer - Drive Innovation in a AI first company!
Description:
Fullstack AI Engineer | Pioneering AI and AI Agents!




What Youâ€™ll Do

We're a fast-moving team transforming financial operations and compliance using production-grade AI. This isn't a research lab, it's about building and shipping real tools that automate the hard stuff and make systems smarter, faster, and more reliable.




You will:

Build internal and external AI agents that automate workflows like invoice validation, reconciliation, KYC/AML checks, and compliance monitoring.
Use tools like GPT-4o, LangChain, n8n, Supabase, and custom Python/Node scripts to create end-to-end automations.
Translate deep domain knowledge from finance and legal into prompt-driven tools, backend logic, and APIs.
Connect your work to our core platform using REST APIs, webhooks, and third-party integrations.
Work closely with product and compliance teams to identify high-value use cases and execute fast.
Document and test your automations to ensure they scale across multiple clients and jurisdictions.
(Optionally) Build user interfaces with Retool, Lovable, or React to expose agent functionality.




Who You Are

You have 2â€“4 years of experience as a fullstack or backend developer.
Youâ€™ve built real AI-powered systems, agents, automations, wrappers, or workflows that do something useful.
You're confident with Python or JavaScript/TypeScript, and experienced with REST APIs and database development.
Youâ€™ve used tools like LangChain, GPT/OpenAI, Claude, Supabase, or n8n, and ideally connected them into working systems.
You enjoy solving real problems, shipping fast, and iterating based on feedback.
You understand how systems interact â€” tools, prompts, logic, APIs, and data flows.
Bonus: experience with finance, compliance, ERP integrations, or process-heavy industries.




Why Join Us

Work on real-world AI use cases, not demos or sandbox projects.
Join a small, highly capable, and product-driven team.
Ship and own projects that impact large, operationally complex organizations.
Help define how AI is used in an industry begging for modernization.
Enjoy a remote-first culture, fast decision-making, and real ownership over your work.




Tech Stack You'll Touch

LLMs: GPT-4o, OpenAI Functions, Claude
Frameworks: LangChain, n8n, Supabase
Languages: Python, Node.js, TypeScript
Data & APIs: REST APIs (internal and external)
Frontend (optional): Retool, Lovable, React
Cloud: Multi-cloud (flexible based on context)




Compensation

Competitive salary tailored to your experience
Remote within Denmark
Autonomy and a flat structure
Pioneer AI and AI Agents internally!
Optional access to co-working space or office (e.g. Aarhus, Copenhagen)




Ready to build real AI systems that matter? Apply now and help us automate the future of financial operations!




Please reach out to the hiring manager if you have any questions:

Luqman Mohammed-Brown - +45 88 74 11 43 / L.Mohammed-brown@tenthrevolution.com

Title: Freelance Software Developer (Python-Rust) - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:


Analyze and understand existing code in Python or C/C++
Migrate logic to idiomatic, safe Rust while preserving functionality
Adapt or port the test suite and ensure behavioral equivalence
Document migration steps and technical decisions


How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python, 1+ year of Rust (or fast learning capability)
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
Experience with PyO3/maturin for Python-Rust interoperability
Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD for hybrid Python-Rust apps
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
Show more
HTML:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in Coding, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

Although every project is unique, you might typically:

  • Analyze and understand existing code in Python or C/C++
  • Migrate logic to idiomatic, safe Rust while preserving functionality
  • Adapt or port the test suite and ensure behavioral equivalence
  • Document migration steps and technical decisions

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements

  • You have a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Software Development, Computer Science, or other related fields.
  • You have at least 3 years of professional experience with Python, 1+ year of Rust (or fast learning capability)
  • Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
  • Experience with PyO3/maturin for Python-Rust interoperability
  • Knowledge of Docker, Kubernetes, and CI/CD for hybrid Python-Rust apps
  • You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines
  • Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge

Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?

  • Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments
  • Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio
  • Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise

Title: Python Developer
Description:
Backend Engineer - Python - Copenhagen




Weâ€™re delighted to be working with one of Europeâ€™s most exciting tech startups, as they continue their mission to become the leader in their market.




Theyâ€™re looking to onboard an experienced backend engineer, to join one of their internal teams.




The Role




In this role, you'll be working as part of the Business Ops team - which focuses on internal processes, developer tools & creating the best possible work environment for both technical & non-technical team members.




You'll work closely with a team of engineers as well as non-technical stakeholders, before crafting innovative solutions to every day problems.




You'll be using Python, with Django being used as their main framework. Whilst this specific role is purely backend focused, they do have space for a Full Stack Engineer in the near future - so don't hesitate to reach out if you have solid TypeScript experience too.




What Youâ€™ll Bring




5+ years of commercial software engineering experience
3+ years of experience working with Python
Demonstratable experience of working with internal teams with non-technical staff
Any experience in TypeScript is a plus, but certainly not required




The Company




With a current team of over 400 and huge growth planned in the next few years, this is an opportunity to get in while the rocket shipâ€™s still near the launchpad.




Their tech is used by tens of thousands of teams across the globe every weekâ€”helping analysts record, analyse, and improve performance with ease.




The companyâ€™s mission is a positive and inclusive one: to ensure access to performance tools, regardless of background, budget, or location.




Their Copenhagen HQ is the coolest office Iâ€™ve ever visited, so Iâ€™m sure youâ€™ll agree. Most of their team are onsite between 3-5 days a week. They offer flexibility on remote working, but their staff like being in the office more often than not.




Sound good? Apply here or contact me directly on jamie.crowley@amicusjobs.com.

Title: AI Engineer
Place: HumlebÃ¦k, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer or Data Scientist â€“ do you want to become an AI Engineer?

Would you like to join us as we scale our AI team? You will be using your experience in bringing the right AI tools to the business to create value.

Join us as we identify the AI models and solutions, we configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

â€Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, youâ€™ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose,â€ says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a relatively new AI team. The team is responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

â€œThis area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. We are working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally â€“ and growing our team along the way,â€ explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplastâ€™s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions, setting up agents, configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails


Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation




Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to test our AI models and make sure we create the best solutions.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you


Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration
Are proficient in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments
Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, .Net or other relevant coding languages
Are familiar with access management and infrastructure as code
Have knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as natural language processing, GenAI, machine learning, deep learning, computer vision, etc.
Are fluent in English
Some travel might be required in connection with project workshops etc.




Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply as we a looking to fill the positions by October 1st.

The positions will remain open until suitable candidates has been found.

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the worldÂ´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward â€“ we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because â€“ and not despite â€“ of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com.

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn. Like us on Facebook.

Title: R&D Scientist - Pathology
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Agilent inspires and supports discoveries that advance the quality of life. We provide life science, diagnostic and applied market laboratories worldwide with instruments, services, consumables, applications, and expertise. Agilent enables customers to gain the answers and insights they seek ---- so they can do what they do best: improve the world around us. Information about Agilent is available at www.agilent.com.

Will you join us in the fight against cancer?

We are hiring 2 R&D scientists for a temporary position (36 Months) to join us in the development and sustain of state-of-the art in vitro diagnostic devices to the benefit of patients throughout the world.

Your primary role will be to generate and update design control documentation for Pathology products. All work will be conducted in accordance with relevant regulatory guidelines and standards.

Your tasks will include:


Scientific contributor
Planning, generation and update of Design Control documentation according to Agilent Quality Management System (QMS)
Sustain activities related to our Pathology Products such as design changes to existing products, or risk file maintenance
Drive Continuous Improvement initiatives
Stakeholder management/communication (internal and external)
Planning of R&D activities for projects in close collaboration with project managers
Work closely with cross-functional teams to engage in collaborative problem-solving, address challenges and ensure compliance through innovative and cooperative solutions.
Serve as the key connector between R&D and other departments and facilitate effective communication and collaboration with various stakeholders to achieve common goals.


You will be based in our Glostrup, Denmark office, working in an exciting and dynamic diverse environment with around 24 colleagues. Our department is divided into two teams. The team you will join includes 3 Design Responsible, 9 R&D Scientists, and a Department Manager.

Qualifications


Masterâ€™s/PhD in Biology, Biochemistry, Biotechnology or similar
Knowledge of IHC (Immunohistochemistry), ISH (in situ hybridization) or special stains is a plus
Experience with Design Control, Risk Management, Design Changes or Manufacturing around Medical/Diagnostic devices is an advantage
Full fluency in English. Note that fluency in Danish is not required


On a personal level, you are rigorous, driven and process oriented. You also have excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interact with many external and internal partners. You enjoy working both autonomously and as part of a team. Whilst being flexible and adaptable, you have also strong planning, organizational and time management skills.

What we offer:


Outstanding company culture
A position in an international and dynamic working place with exciting challenges and opportunities
An exciting and diverse work environment with many challenging tasks
A chance to be part of the lifecycle support of state-of-the art IHC, ISH and primary stains products to the benefit of cancer patients, worldwide
Great colleagues and a strong team spirit
Many opportunities for personal career and expertise development
Company pension scheme, individual bonus plan, private health care, medical & life insurance


We will make sure you get the training and development opportunities you need to become the best in your field.

Additional Details

This job has a full time weekly schedule.

Agilent Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

Travel Required:

No

Shift:

Day

Duration:

Over 12 Months

Job Function:

R&D

Title: Freelance ServiceNow Expert - AI Trainer
Description:
This opportunity is only for candidates currently residing in the specified country. Your location may affect eligibility and rates.

At Mindrift, innovation meets opportunity. We believe in using the power of collective intelligence to ethically shape the future of AI.

What We Do

The Mindrift platform connects specialists with AI projects from major tech innovators. Our mission is to unlock the potential of Generative AI by tapping into real-world expertise from across the globe.

About The Role

GenAI models are improving very quickly, and one of our goals is to make them capable of addressing specialized questions and achieving complex reasoning skills. If you join the platform as an AI Tutor in ServiceNow, you'll have the opportunity to collaborate on these projects.

How To Get Started

Simply apply to this post, qualify, and get the chance to contribute to projects aligned with your skills, on your own schedule. From creating training prompts to refining model responses, you'll help shape the future of AI while ensuring technology benefits everyone.

Requirements


You have a Master's degree or Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration
You have at least 3 years of professional experience working with ServiceNow
Your level of English is advanced (C1) or above
You are ready to learn new methods, able to switch between tasks and topics quickly and sometimes work with challenging, complex guidelines.
Our freelance role is fully remote so, you just need a laptop, internet connection, time available and enthusiasm to take on a challenge


Benefits

Why this freelance opportunity might be a great fit for you?


Take part in a part-time, remote, freelance project that fits around your primary professional or academic commitments.
Work on advanced AI projects and gain valuable experience that enhances your portfolio.
Influence how future AI models understand and communicate in your field of expertise
